commit_message:
use class methods for api extensions

Commit I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705 made a number of the
extensions methods class-level in APIExtensionDescriptor. This patch
updates the code to use them as classmethods rather than creating an
instance of the extension.

Change-Id: If136d7fd55ad8d7817a9c61319f2a85c721dd683

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-28 17:13:19.000000000', 'message': "Loosen the assertion for logging scope type warnings

We have tests to make sure we raise a 403 Forbidden in the event we
catch an exception from oslo.policy due to InvalidScope. An assertion
in these tests made sure we logged a warning by checking a mock was
called exactly once.

This is going to fail when we start deprecating policies in Stein in
favor of ones that enable system scope checking. Instead of checking
that assertion is called only once, let's just make sure it is called
at least once with the arguments we expect. Otherwise we're going to
catch false positives with the assertion because deprecated policies
are also logged for operators.

Change-Id: I5da718d5b31e90f1aef7d5b457b3c772eb57d1fb

commit_message:
Loosen the assertion for logging scope type warnings

We have tests to make sure we raise a 403 Forbidden in the event we
catch an exception from oslo.policy due to InvalidScope. An assertion
in these tests made sure we logged a warning by checking a mock was
called exactly once.

This is going to fail when we start deprecating policies in Stein in
favor of ones that enable system scope checking. Instead of checking
that assertion is called only once, let's just make sure it is called
at least once with the arguments we expect. Otherwise we're going to
catch false positives with the assertion because deprecated policies
are also logged for operators.

Change-Id: I5da718d5b31e90f1aef7d5b457b3c772eb57d1fb

subject: Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools
messages: [{'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-10-15 03:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-16 09:49:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nI personally consider this particular change a waste of time given how infrequently people need to touch these files, but it's easier just get them merged and out of the way than debate them"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 03:55:51.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of I1b41efac219fca44e2548fc36633724d0ecfc0cb
from the openstack-dev/oslo-cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: If94ca7bcf92366570623feda58c19314a6ad0bad
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of I1b41efac219fca44e2548fc36633724d0ecfc0cb
from the openstack-dev/oslo-cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: If94ca7bcf92366570623feda58c19314a6ad0bad

commit_message:
Add openvswitch upgrade tasks where ovn controller is deployed.

deployed.

other services need this

commit_message:
Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of I1b41efac219fca44e2548fc36633724d0ecfc0cb
from the openstack-dev/oslo-cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: I58fac7a90ae611217a978a6a0190abb8efca44e2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 05:41:06.000000000', 'message': "Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

Closes-Bug: #1795078

Change-Id: If1e355d6174f15a1880e97115a2cf3f9f4be837e
"}, {'created': '2018-10-10 12:54:19.000000000', 'message': "Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

Closes-Bug: #1795078

Change-Id: If1e355d6174f15a1880e97115a2cf3f9f4be837e
(cherry picked from commit 020651ad3d14066af34dc5d1d96cec7c6ffe5cd9)
"}]
commit_message:
Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

Closes-Bug: #1795078

Change-Id: If1e355d6174f15a1880e97115a2cf3f9f4be837e
(cherry picked from commit 020651ad3d14066af34dc5d1d96cec7c6ffe5cd9)

commit_message:
Remove the ITRI DISCO driver

The ITRI DISCO driver was marked unsupported in
the Rocky release.  It hasn't reported on a patch in
74 days and hasn't successfully executed CI in 231 days.

This falls well outside our CI requirements and therefore
the driver is being removed.

Change-Id: Iab4288983e8e13a3b9d59b30887d1934a2eb66c8

Is this to be merged or just a 'not for merge' patch?

Generally if you want to increase it you can just delete the code that decreased it to 60 secs.

I'm not sure what's the problem though, if server didn't come up within a minute it's very unlikely it will come up at all, thats why the timeout was reduced initially.
Do you see that it actually causes tests to fail?
Usually the problem is somewhere else and the timeout is just a symptom."}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-10-16 10:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Cleaning up changes that seem to be abandoned or are older than two months. If you think this was an error and the change is still relevant, please be free to restore it. Sorry for any inconvenience that I might have caused by this.'}]

commit_message:
devstack: increase build timeout from 60 to 180

Now with tempest, there are too many failure to wait for server
termination. increase built timeout to see its outcome.

Change-Id: Iae7859db796132ac95b3f407da0cc7d749d6b405

subject: do not merge yet: devstack: remove vpnservice workaround

commit_message:
do not merge yet: devstack: remove vpnservice workaround

This patch removes work around for new netvirt introduced by
the change id of I2d2c2e5e2fa1bf7ffebabfe22b9e9dccc7b5fd20 or
the changeset of 353a8cd4867a921d5d3d8dfd71a6aee2b0e84387

Change-Id: Ief4389fb3fd86b3378fd17d4f44468425dc1ad38

commit_message:
L2 gateway connection attribute change during full sync

L2 gateway driver v2 changes object, it removes 'l2_gateway_id'
and put 'gateway_id'. During full sync the same things has to be
therefore a method named 'journal_processor' has been provided
in l2 gateway driver.

If other drivers in future has to do this kind of processing, they
simply need to provide a method 'journal_processor'.

closes-bug: #1715133
Change-Id: I87b4a5d81bff6c5a76d3db380981b59c7a89eab5

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-01 06:38:48.000000000', 'message': 'Improve delete journal entry processing

A delete entry with not found status code can be considered
completed in journal processing. Currently, it tries multiple
times and then moved to failed state and finall recovery is done.
So the purpose of this patch is to move them in completed state.

Change-Id: I668054c3c440960b1004d6aa4d39f39a64789576
Closes-bug: #1728779
'}]
commit_message:
Improve delete journal entry processing

A delete entry with not found status code can be considered
completed in journal processing. Currently, it tries multiple
times and then moved to failed state and finall recovery is done.
So the purpose of this patch is to move them in completed state.

Change-Id: I668054c3c440960b1004d6aa4d39f39a64789576
Closes-bug: #1728779

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-14 07:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2017-11-15 11:07:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31: Code-Review-2

(8 comments)

This patch is quite huge, I didn't review it all since it's really hard to keep track of everything especially when it keeps changing.

My suggestion to proceed faster and cleaner is to abandon this patch and re-do it in steps (each in it's own separate patch):
1. Introduce the base mechanism for this.
2. Adapt the base mechanism for L2.
3. Repeat 2 for the other drivers/plugins.

Otherwise I feel we just keep trying to hit a moving target and basically getting everyone involved frustrated in the process.

I really want to see this change merged but not because we defaulted to merge it since we're tired of reviewing it (and our brains hurt), but because we're on agreement on it and are happy with the proposed change."}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2017-11-15 12:32:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31: Code-Review-1

Couldn't agree more with Mike. I think that dividing it is the way to go. That way we will be able to merge it sooner and with more certainty that what we are merging is correct."}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-10-16 10:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Cleaning up changes that seem to be abandoned or are older than two months. If you think this was an error and the change is still relevant, please be free to restore it. Sorry for any inconvenience that I might have caused by this.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-03 13:49:46.000000000', 'message': "[WIP][don't REVIEW] Recovery: Moved resource fetching in drivers

Due to different interface for fetching resources information,
we need a lot of conditions during recovery.

This patch moved get_resources methods inside the drivers. It
will keep complexity away from full sync and keep specific details
to, where they belong.

Change-Id: I678bf3ba065cb8c93fa39d9e5f6d32f7e0184ce6
Closes-bug: #1713697

commit_message:
Recovery: Moved resource fetching in drivers

Due to different interface for fetching resources information,
we need a lot of conditions during recovery.

This patch adds _recovery and _full_sync methods inside the
drivers. It will keep complexity away from full sync and keep
specific details to, where they belong.

Change-Id: I678bf3ba065cb8c93fa39d9e5f6d32f7e0184ce6
Closes-bug: #1713697

Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-14 10:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-15 03:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-15 03:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-15 03:53:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-15 03:53:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-15 06:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2017-11-15 12:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Please add unit tests for the new behavior'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2017-11-15 13:00:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

A couple of comments.

1. I don't like the particular solution. Better solutions that I can think of are:
    a. enclose the lock-unlock in an overarching transaction so it will be unlocked in case of failures.
    b. change the locking mechanism and instead of doing PENDING/PROCESSING we use a MySQL level lock.
    c. Check against the time when the last operation of a specific periodic task was executed and decide based on that.

2. Please don't submit patches without UT. You know it will not be approved and also it's a misuse of CI resources. If you need to discuss a specific solution, you can discuss with us on the channel. If it's not comfortable then explain that with a comment so we don't waste time reviewing but instead we just analyze the solution. On top of that you can also do this as a draft commit `git review --draft`.

3. It is also a good idea to summarize the solution in the commit message, so we have something to compare against it. Which makes also for a better commit message."}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-10-16 10:31:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Cleaning up changes that seem to be abandoned or are older than two months. If you think this was an error and the change is still relevant, please be free to restore it. Sorry for any inconvenience that I might have caused by this.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-18 07:00:54.000000000', 'message': 'Recovery of periodic task

If we a process acquire the lock on an entry and get crashed in
that case periodic tasks can not be executed by other process,
on the same host or on other host.

This patch make sure task acquire locks after certain period of
time even if that lock acquired. Time to reacquire should be long
enough to avoid false reacquire.

This patch brings discussion on the table for the discussion.

Change-Id: Ibe845d36299e41c3c38fa3e8f168c1bf79a827a2
closes-bug: #1711506

Change-Id: Ibe845d36299e41c3c38fa3e8f168c1bf79a827a2
closes-bug: #1711506
'}]
commit_message:
Recovery of periodic task

If we a process acquire the lock on an entry and get crashed in
that case periodic tasks can not be executed by other process,
on the same host or on other host.

This patch make sure task release locks after certain period of
time even if that lock is owned. Time to reacquire should be long
enough to avoid false reacquire.

Change-Id: Ibe845d36299e41c3c38fa3e8f168c1bf79a827a2
closes-bug: #1711506

commit_message:
run test_l3_odl with both l3_odl and l3_odl_v2

The test cases in test_l3_odl is generic and can be run with
both l3_odl and l3_odl_v2.
So make those test cases run with both l3_odl and l3_odl_v2.

Change-Id: Icb7fb5ffd2784497d5faa9efa066fdb3d80e84d0

commit_message:
test_journal: don't create journal thread twice

The parent class OpenDaylightConfigBase creates already journal thread,
so it doesn't make sense for OpenDaylightJournalThreadTest to create
journal thread again. Just use instance OpenDaylightConfigBase created.

Change-Id: I6a4519ce4d726e9f8767ae2f42e01fbf9fab9d22

commit_message:
WIP: FWaaS V2 API support

This patch heavily depends on the neutron-fwaas WIP patches[1]
to support FWaaS V2 API.
Neutron-fwaas has not adopt the service driver model yet. This
leaves networking-odl in implemeting a pseudo/fake agent on
behalf of all the compute nodes. Once neutron-fwaas adopts the
service driver model, networking-odl will move to that.

Pieces that are missing currently:
* hook up to ODL notification and update firewall_group status
* journal records dependency checking
* populate this fwaas pseudo agent to neutron agent DB somehow
* setup.cfg entry
* unit tests of course
* ...

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/323971/

Change-Id: I8832b0b49ce4fb6af4b37f40d57c9d4c5d439fa7

Possibly localrc change cause regression. check email:
Hi third-party CI operators,

This is for those who use devstack-gate with localrc. You might have started seeing failures since [1] landed. This is due to a few devstack settings now being ignored. When devstack sees that you have both localrc and [[local|localrc]] section in local.conf, it only uses localrc file.

A solution is to move your localrc settings into [[local|localrc]] section of local.conf. For a temporary fix you can also pin devstack-gate to a version before [1], until your configuration is migrated.

I hope this saves some of you some debugging time. I see at least one CI that is currently affected (nova Virtuozzo Storage CI).

- gate-dsvm-networking-odl-functional-carbon-snapshot http://logs.openstack.org/39/356839/8/check/gate-dsvm-networking-odl-functional-carbon-snapshot/f77f477/ : SUCCESS in 15m 59s
- networking-odl-coverage-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/39/356839/8/check/networking-odl-coverage-ubuntu-xenial/60fd5fb/ : SUCCESS in 9m 44s'}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2017-03-05 13:41:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-2

This seems like a bad idea to me, GUARD_TRANSACTION was just added as a temporary workaround which Neutron team will remove at any time now and IMHO is not an API we can or should count on.

Instead what should be done is adjusting the L3 driver to work with the precommit messages that are being sent on router.
For FIP the best option right now is to create the journal row right after the call and in the meanwhile fix Neutron to also send a precommit event for FIP operations.

Let me know if you think I'm wrong.."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2017-03-07 16:31:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Yes, GUARD_TRANSACTION is short-term work around and the right fix in short term is to migrate to L3 flavor driver. It would take a while, though.
So we shouldn't spend much time except bug fix. So GUARD_TRANSACTION is okay for l3_odl_v2.py."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2017-03-07 16:32:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

the right fix in short term -> the right fix in long term.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2017-03-07 16:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2017-03-07 16:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-07 19:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified-1

commit_message:
l3_odl_v2: use context.session

use context.session instead of getting session from
db_api. This patch also sets GUARD_TRANSACTION to avoid
the exception when operations are done from within same
transaction.

Closes-Bug: #1611533
Closes-Bug: #1614775
Co-Authored-by: Edwin Zhai <edwin.zhai@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ic32a094af2dbfe3fd9b898ba371997a0bf1043e1

If you think the other way around, then i would like you to add bug ID from that bug here as well. Let's keep everything updated."}, {'account_id': 15070, 'date': '2017-03-23 13:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

the background:

1. networking-odl/vagrant/integration/multimode is to reproduce tempest failure:

a. download configuration from Jenkins
b. vagrant up and debug the issue.

2. all vagrant file/script is to simulate devstack-gate & project-config.

3. recently, devstack introduce LOCAL_CONFIG_SET to add "[local | localrc]" in local.conf'}, {'account_id': 15070, 'date': '2017-03-23 13:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

my intention is to download control.conf/compute.conf from Jenkins instead of manuel edit.

if you want to edit control.conf/compute.conf, pls just remove the follow part and update control.conf/compute.conf:

download primary & subnode configuration from jenkins log. example:
# curl http://logs.openstack.org/22/408422/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl-multinode-carbon-snapshot-nv/ef988ee/logs/localrc.txt.gz > control.conf
# curl http://logs.openstack.org/22/408422/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl-multinode-carbon-snapshot-nv/ef988ee/logs/subnode-2/localrc.txt.gz  > compute.conf
# vagrant up

Note: we already include control.conf & compute.conf in this example.'}, {'account_id': 15070, 'date': '2017-03-23 13:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fix devstack failure inside vagrant

This patch enables n-cell service to avoid following error:
"No hosts found to map to cell, exiting."

Change-Id: Iff3a9e145e5d2900e6ef2ed2ea0fcfb7e060b6c8
Closes-Bug: #1667588
Partially-Implements: blueprint patch-scrub
Co-Authored-By: Rajiv Kumar <rajiv.kumar@nectechnologies.in>

commit_message:
Remove Unneccessary Post copying

All that is needed to debug job will be in logs directory,
there is unneccessary coping of tox and nose_results.html
and test_results will be included in logs.

Change-Id: I2d8acc43a0f95743fc7095fbd0e55759fd6dbab4

commit_message:
devstack: use veth for net netvirt

set Q_USE_PUBLIC_VETH=True for new netvirt.
As new netvirt requires network interface to connected to br-int
for external network. Q_USE_PUBLIC_VETH needs to be set.
see _configure_opendaylight_l3_new_netvirt in entry_point.

Change-Id: I01766178c10bdd4cac22a351ed562ced59fcdc79

subject: Revert "Remove unit tests for ML2 Mechanism driver"
messages:
[{'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 15:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 15:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is a neutron wide issue.
you should have discussion in neutron for the direction.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-30 20:36:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Do you have a reference that says that it should be used like that? It would be an interesting argument to open that discussion. 

We also raised this in the mailing list and there was no response from the neutron team, because I think it's not relevant for them. 

As those unit tests don't have an added value, I think we should revert this only if we have that discussion and find a way for them to add value."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 21:13:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There are many example in Neutorn repo and other networking-* repo.

you should reach them by not only mailing list, but also other ways. IRC meeting etc. We're a part of neutron community. and this kind of issue should be addressed uniformly in Neutron community."}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2018-01-31 10:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree we don't need to revert this unless there's a good reason to keep this tests.

"Everyone else is doing it" is not a good argument, as everyone else may do as they please anyway but we should focus on what's important to us and makes sense to us, and it doesn't make sense to keep these tests.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-10-16 10:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Cleaning up changes that seem to be abandoned or are older than two months. If you think this was an error and the change is still relevant, please be free to restore it. Sorry for any inconvenience that I might have caused by this.'}]

commit_message:
Enabling bgpvpn for new mechanism of full sync and recovery

Enables bgpvpn for new mechanism of full sync and recovery.
network association and router association are not needed to full
sync and recovery because they are attributes of bgpvpn and gets
synced when bgpvpn is updated or created during the full sync
and recovery.

Change-Id: Ic1505f11e12de4c26379f5e65fd7436b9d6b3efd
Partial-bug: #1713697

commit_message:
Run tempest tests on multinode CI.

Tempest logs for multinode CI aren't running tempest test because
DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_NOTESTS is set to 1 and infra exits the job
before running those tests [1].

[1]. https://goo.gl/urTh9u

Change-Id: Ifd29fc9465725b5217c4426ccb0a205c64158417

commit_message:
exception in get_pending_delete_ops_with_parent

row.data can be None. add None check to
get_pending_delete_ops_with_parent().

https://jira.opendaylight.org/browse/NETVIRT-896
This patch is to address the above bug report.

Change-Id: I36be1175ab2612994969e1b9ec56007547238b27

[{'created': '2017-12-13 11:49:40.000000000', 'message': 'Enable l2gateway for new full sync and recovery mechanism

This patch enables new mechanism for full sync and recovery
of l2gateway driver. L2 gateway connection name differs for
fetching a resources therefore get_method_name_by_resource_suffix
method has been overriden to return correct method name.

For full sync l2 gateway resource has to be updated because
different attribute is expected by ODL then provided by neutron.

commit_message:
Enable l2gateway for new full sync and recovery mechanism

This patch enables new mechanism for full sync and recovery
of l2gateway driver. L2 gateway connection name differs for
fetching a resources therefore get_method_name_by_resource_suffix
method has been overriden to return correct method name.

For full sync l2 gateway resource has to be updated because
different attribute is expected by ODL then provided by neutron.

Change-Id: I83d742e72377c7bc85c5550308e903bdab0887e0
Partial-Bug: #1713697

(1 comment)

nit update, please'}, {'account_id': 25587, 'date': '2018-01-23 07:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-23 08:18:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Although this change does the trick, there is an inherent problem in the way things are tested and that's why the file is never closed. 

You see, when you call main with that argument it goes to configure the oslo logger according to that option for further logging. That module has a watcher that will recreate the file again if it's moved or deleted. And, since the oslo logger is never deleted nor garbage collected -as it is instantiated as a module member- it won't be closed until the interpreter ends. 

There is an added problem to these tests, the tests are not self contained. Any change in the logger configuration is never restored back to the status that it was before the test started. This would affect all following tests that use this logger as well. 

IMHO there needs to be a refactor that assures the idempotency of tests on this module and achieve the test objectives in another way."}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-01-29 06:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22380, 'date': '2018-04-04 12:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For tracking purposes, here are those feature strings added to the yang schema [0]. Note that this is just the presence in the schema, the feature negotiation will still not receive the features. Whoever adds the actual support in ODL for these features should also add code to write these to the md-sal so that they will be sent during feature negotation here [1].

[0] https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/70331/
[1] https://github.com/opendaylight/netvirt/blob/be3d631b6d22472982b35c3350815c210ffc5d7f/neutronvpn/impl/src/main/java/org/opendaylight/netvirt/neutronvpn/NeutronvpnManager.java#L228'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2018-04-04 17:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 16:34:00.000000000', 'message': 'Enable feature negotiation for QoS driver

This patch introduces following changes
  1. Enable feature negotiation
  2. Enable DSCP Marking rule for QoS driver

Currently, QoS driver supports only bandwidth limit rule but
ODL also supports dscp marking, this patch enhance existing
QoS driver to supprt DSCP Marking rule.

Supprted rules for QoS drivers are hardcoded, feature negotiation
has been added to support rules as per ODL enabled features.

Change-Id: I5f6e60f26b302e40c70f183ae7f80c7759034a66
closes-bug: #1686625

commit_message:
Enable feature negotiation for QoS driver

Supported rules for QoS drivers are hardcoded, feature negotiation
has been added to support rules as per ODL enabled features.

Change-Id: I5f6e60f26b302e40c70f183ae7f80c7759034a66
closes-bug: #1686625

commit_message:
Log if ODL's websocket is not initialized yet

Apparently, it is technically possible for websocket
subscriptions to be received before before the required
infra is available and initialized in ODL. A recent change
has ODL returning 503 in this case. This patch logs that
before waiting and retrying.

Change-Id: I47918d0f3d9f74ed0989dcfea57c24d2934479f6

commit_message:
Fix disabled services for grenade job

As grenade is still using neutron-legacy, there's check in
devstack for disabled services which will return False for
is_neutron_legacy_enabled if neutron key is in disabled services
there by corrupting deploy by mixing lib/neutron and neutron-legacy.

Change-Id: I333c4693fc2e9c8da8d9f304f0c27c1854df258f

commit_message:
Enable MySQL Cluster Support for networking_odl

This enables the usage of the mysql_enable_ndb setting from oslo.db
from bug 1564110.This allows operators to select from MySQL (InnoDB)
or MySQL Cluster (NDB) as the storage engine backend.

Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3
Depends-On: I9f1fd2a87fdf75332de2339d3ff4f08ce9220dcf
Change-Id: If51116dc24ff29f7254ee4725109db3826c5c748
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support

for better readability.

(1 comment)

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-09-24 10:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I don't really want to encourage users to use "latest", as its not a stable API. Could we instead just change the urls to the latest supported data that you are representing here. That will hopefully mean the docs will not be miss-leading at some point in the future (if we say, remove a key in a future version).'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-09-25 02:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I don't really want to encourage users to use "latest", as its not
 > a stable API. Could we instead just change the urls to the latest
 > supported data that you are representing here. That will hopefully
 > mean the docs will not be miss-leading at some point in the future
 > (if we say, remove a key in a future version).

Actually I am fine with both. However since this *latest* doc is intended to represent the latest state, whenever there is change in the response body of a newer version, the doc should get updated accordingly right after if not at the same time. In this sense using latest should not be so misleading as long as users are always checking the context to find out what the latest version is.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-09-26 17:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-08 11:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-09 00:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-10-09 20:45:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The reason why we don't recommend the "latest" microversion is microversions can contain backward incompatible changes.
Can the metadata versions also allow backward incompatible changes?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-10 23:15:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Can the metadata versions also allow backward incompatible changes?

Technically yes, although I don't know if we've had a case where we've *removed* anything from the response body, but it's been discussed here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580742/"}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-10-11 00:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Matt, I see.
I still have a question about John's comment.
"2018-08-27" was recommended as a stable version instead of "latest",
but actually "latest" means "2018-08-27" at this time as Melanie's point on the code.
So IIUC "latest" means a stable version always, not?'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-11 00:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Thanks Matt, I see.
 > I still have a question about John's comment.
 > "2018-08-27" was recommended as a stable version instead of
 > "latest",
 > but actually "latest" means "2018-08-27" at this time as Melanie's
 > point on the code.
 > So IIUC "latest" means a stable version always, not?

I think what John means by "stable" is that the API result is stable or consistent across releases. If someone writes their automation to query "latest", then in Rocky version "2018-08-27" would be returned, but when they upgrade to Stein, they get version "2019-04-11" == "latest" (if anything is added to metadata API in Stein).'}, {'account_id': 23312, 'date': '2018-10-11 00:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-10-11 18:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> I think what John means by "stable" is that the API result is stable
 > or consistent across releases. If someone writes their automation to
 > query "latest", then in Rocky version "2018-08-27" would be returned,
 > but when they upgrade to Stein, they get version "2019-04-11" == "latest" (if anything is added to metadata API in Stein).

Ah, I see. Thanks Melanie.
It is good to update it to "2018-08-27" instead of "latest".
Maybe we need to update it in each release, right?'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-10-15 03:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-10-15 04:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-24276 : SUCCESS in 56m 33s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-10-15 05:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/602593/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 00m 05s'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-10-15 16:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-16 00:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Looks OK to me'}]

If an instance having iSCSI volumes attached is being
live-migrated, a Planned VM is created at the destination.
If the live-migration fails, the Planned VM is not cleaned

commit_message:
hyperv: Cleans up live migration Planned VM

If an instance having iSCSI volumes attached is being
live-migrated, a Planned VM is created at the destination.
If the live-migration fails, the Planned VM is not cleaned
up at the destination.

This patch will ensure that rollback_live_migration_at_destination
is being called on live-migration failure for Hyper-V compute nodes,
which will clean up the Planned VM.

Depends-On: I91636a82b057f566eab9887c422911163668f556

Change-Id: I4d61325793ed559dede408813ebda5aed2b0f110
Closes-Bug: #1604078
(cherry picked from commit 70296431908208375677ae428a147f312b60e1ad)

commit_message:
use common rpc and exceptions from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.rpc and exceptions were rehomed into neutron-lib and
are currently shimmed in neutron [1]

This patch consumes those modules from neutron-lib by using lib's
modules rather than neutrons.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586525/

Change-Id: I28144714c4c58dfafe089a66aa73ecbb7eb21cf9

commit_message:
add local tox targets for pep8 and py3

This patch adds local tox targets for pep8 and python 3 as per [1]
that will install dependencies in editable mode.
To run them use the pep8-dev and py3-dev targets respectively.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-sibling-setup

Change-Id: Ia4dc72581e4c0bce7c452969078c7abf18abdd4c

commit_message:
remove external_network_bridge option

The external_network_bridge option is deprecated/legacy and being
removed from neutron [1]. This patch removes the external_network_bridge
option iniset from FWaaS.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567369/

Change-Id: I5aa5617df81030d620b4190df1f67c1e880e79b8

commit_message:
Fix next link in get resource list rest API

Fix the issue where `next` link in the response of the REST API, when
used with pagination, gets corrupted and makes it unusable. After this
fix, next link should be readily usable.

Change-Id: Idf45a59e0b07d8306cc82391679fe30a9cd2f0c1
Closes-Bug: #1793344

Support for the [oslo_messaging_rabbit] section has been removed in
oslo.messaging==9.0.0 package [1].
That's why integration tests failures on build devstack step.

This is the moment where we need to use the transport_url directive
in the [DEFAULT] section instead.

https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/unreleased.html

Change-Id: Id6c5a9198d5a213cb085407a1d8b534e7c755f69
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-10-13 18:15:04.000000000', 'message': "Be compilance with latest oslo.messaging

Support for the [oslo_messaging_rabbit] section has been removed in
oslo.messaging==9.0.0 package [1].
That's why integration tests failures on build devstack step.

This is the moment where we need to use the transport_url directive
in the [DEFAULT] section instead.

Moreover rpc_backend property (which was used in trove to enable fake
RPC backend) has been removed from DEFAULT section and API tests
fails on TIME_OUT as they starts on rabbit RPC backend.

Fake RPC can be now configured as described here [2]:
transport_url = 'fake:/'

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/unreleased.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/configuration/conffixture.html

Change-Id: Id6c5a9198d5a213cb085407a1d8b534e7c755f69
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Be compilance with latest oslo.messaging

Support for the [oslo_messaging_rabbit] section has been removed in
oslo.messaging==9.0.0 package [1].
That's why integration tests failures on build devstack step.

This is the moment where we need to use the transport_url directive
in the [DEFAULT] section instead.

Moreover rpc_backend property (which was used in trove to enable fake
RPC backend) has been removed from DEFAULT section and API tests
fails on TIME_OUT as they starts on rabbit RPC backend.

Fake RPC can be now configured as described here [2]:
transport_url = 'fake:/'

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/unreleased.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/configuration/conffixture.html

Change-Id: Id6c5a9198d5a213cb085407a1d8b534e7c755f69
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>

subject: Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools
messages: [{'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-10-15 03:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-16 09:49:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nI personally consider this particular change a waste of time given how infrequently people need to touch these files, but it's easier just get them merged and out of the way than debate them"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 03:55:48.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of I1b41efac219fca44e2548fc36633724d0ecfc0cb
from the openstack-dev/oslo-cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: Id1e769be63b03fff0a42cbdfa1232d63d0ba8993
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of I1b41efac219fca44e2548fc36633724d0ecfc0cb
from the openstack-dev/oslo-cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: Id1e769be63b03fff0a42cbdfa1232d63d0ba8993

[{'created': '2018-09-27 13:59:40.000000000', 'message': 'Replace bootstrap_nodeid with SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name

This solves the problem that bootstrap_nodeid, which is set to the
first node in each role via t-h-t, can match potentially more than
one node - e.g in the event that a service is deployed such that it
spans more than one role.

The SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name is automatically generated
based on the composable service template service_name, and this
considers all roles where the service is enabled, e.g it should
only evaluate true once regardles off the roles where the service
is enabled.

commit_message:
Replace bootstrap_nodeid with SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name

This solves the problem that bootstrap_nodeid, which is set to the
first node in each role via t-h-t, can match potentially more than
one node - e.g in the event that a service is deployed such that it
spans more than one role.

The SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name is automatically generated
based on the composable service template service_name, and this
considers all roles where the service is enabled, e.g it should
only evaluate true once regardles off the roles where the service
is enabled.

Change-Id: I48ec4549552910f3cb8db960b0ff10a6c61b4bb9
Partial-Bug: #1792613

commit_message:
NFS Backup: Avoid TypeError in os-brick when not configured

If backup_share is not set, a TypeError is raised from
os-brick, because this code is run before the config options
are validated.

Don't try to initialize the path if this is not set.

Closes-Bug: #1797227
Change-Id: I96e104f0e0da0257c48bbaffc2b436f670ccdb76

commit_message:
Add scripts to the head section

For consumers that also call the add_javascript() function scripts are
added to the _static folder but not loaded in the HTML resulting in them
not working.

This change iterates over the script_files lists and adds the needed
<script></script> element.

Closes-Bug: 1798002
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607538/
Change-Id: Ie39e138314fed91f59cd9cb5d78d676c04fb78e6

Monasca-thresh inherits from the Storm container, but we want
it to write logs to the Monasca logs directory. In this commit

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers

commit_message:
Fix potential Monasca-thresh start failure

Monasca-thresh inherits from the Storm container, but we want
it to write logs to the Monasca logs directory. In this commit
we overwrite the script which configures the Storm log directory
with the Monasca script.

Change-Id: Id961134e424117ebefb088021faaf37fa02757d7
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers

[{'created': '2018-10-15 17:28:47.000000000', 'message': "py3: Don't purge python-six and fix purge ret val

python-six is also used by crmsh in HA deployment so don't purge it
on OpenStack upgrade or we lose the ability to manage the corosync/
pacemaker cluster.

Also ensure non-empty package list is returned for rocky+ in
determine_purge_packages.

Change-Id: Ia614ec0f9dce907952cab32db2725abe47ef404e
"}]
commit_message:
py3: Don't purge python-six and fix purge ret val

python-six is also used by crmsh in HA deployment so don't purge it
on OpenStack upgrade or we lose the ability to manage the corosync/
pacemaker cluster.

Also ensure non-empty package list is returned for rocky+ in
determine_purge_packages.

Change-Id: Ia614ec0f9dce907952cab32db2725abe47ef404e

[{'created': '2018-10-09 21:16:23.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I902f713cbbcea4ed1994afc8abcc78aef392729d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I902f713cbbcea4ed1994afc8abcc78aef392729d

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I365260d42e6cfa8e7a357c9a8d2154128a743b4a

commit_message:
Avoid restarting a child when terminating

When sending a SIGTERM to the main glance-api process,
it was sending a SIGTERM to its children
but then also re-spawning its first dead child.

Closes-bug: #1714240

Change-Id: Ibef426c198d287bbdac4e764fd654edba4b7c2d6
(cherry picked from commit 877cd166b56ec4b7f5530ea9bf1587077692275b)

commit_message:
Add multihash checks to functional tests

Refactor the image functional tests to pull common code into a
utility function and add multihash checks to those functional tests
that are only checking that the legacy checksum is set correctly.

Change-Id: If4e2dbb6db2bee0b8d8e307ce2f7f7bd15cddea8
(cherry picked from commit 432b9f6c24f8c4a121767b60a0f81eb2185d1ed5)

0fa368a7441528457b7bcb99f8a860d7987b9ba6 refs/heads/guits-update_req_master
79bd06ad28d8a078bd95923b230eb8d5b66095b2 refs/heads/master

which breaks the script when bumping SHAs. As such, lets make it

commit_message:
scripts: sources-branch-updater: Make regexp for master branch stricter

The regexp does not work properly when the upstream repo has many
branches named 'master' such as ceph-ansible

0fa368a7441528457b7bcb99f8a860d7987b9ba6 refs/heads/guits-update_req_master
79bd06ad28d8a078bd95923b230eb8d5b66095b2 refs/heads/master

which breaks the script when bumping SHAs. As such, lets make it
stricter by simply matching /master$ instead.

Change-Id: I24526a358d7a21821f8c9789ba199863981f8d7b

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ie49435519b267c8e3245e0b57cbdf11979ba8cc9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-27 18:45:43.000000000', 'message': 'Use system protocol assigments for iptables protocol map

Merge the system protocol assignments into the iptables name
to protocol mapping array, IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_NAME_MAP, so that
systems with updated or new values in /etc/protocols can
successfully install iptables rules.

This was done as an IptablesFirewallDriver() instance mapping
since there is typically only a single instance per-agent,
and it also allows us to more easily unit test it.

Change-Id: Ib73def4e2a9e3644462fdee312768382fcb800a5
Closes-Bug: #1783378
(cherry picked from commit 034db863a02ce38a520e4b8aa3a65e1ccdb37f30)
'}]
commit_message:
Use system protocol assigments for iptables protocol map

Merge the system protocol assignments into the iptables name
to protocol mapping array, IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_NAME_MAP, so that
systems with updated or new values in /etc/protocols can
successfully install iptables rules.

This was done as an IptablesFirewallDriver() instance mapping
since there is typically only a single instance per-agent,
and it also allows us to more easily unit test it.

Change-Id: Ib73def4e2a9e3644462fdee312768382fcb800a5
Closes-Bug: #1783378
(cherry picked from commit 034db863a02ce38a520e4b8aa3a65e1ccdb37f30)

commit_message:
Fixing gate failing due to bad AMQP virtual_host

We are currently hitting this error with the gate.
> NOT_ALLOWED - access to vhost 'None' refused for user 'stackrabbit'

This patch fixes this by using the inbuilt devstack construct
to create an appropriate transport_url.

Change-Id: I9aae96094b7bd8bc148ae3e42c118ba160eff8ae

subject: Provide network name associated with the role to ServiceNetMap
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jenss', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-10-12 06:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-10-12 06:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-10-12 14:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

It's an interesting patch, how will this affect service templates that use the service netmap to get
information about the network and configure service accordingly?

For example: puppet/services/snmp.yaml
        snmpd_network:
          str_replace:
            template: "%{hiera('$NETWORK_subnet')}"
            params:
              $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, SnmpdNetwork]}
        tripleo.snmp.firewall_rules:
          '124 snmp':
            dport: 161
            proto: 'udp'
            source:
              if:
              - snmpd_network_unset
              - "%{hiera('snmpd_network')}"
              - {get_param: SnmpdIpSubnet}


 We would end up with firewall rules on different roles only allowing trafic from nodes on the same network?


Also, I have concerns about the way we do routed networks using different composable networks.
For two compute roles:

 compute_roleA_01: InternalApi
 compute_roleB_01: InternalApi1

The hosts entry on Compute_A would include:

 compute_roleB_01.internalapi.cloudname   <- Maps to controlplane IP because we default to that.
 compute_roleB_01.internalapi1.cloudname  <- Maps to the IP on the InternalApi1 network.

Is there a chance compute_roleA_01 look for compute_roleB_01 on it's InternalApi network, and traffic end's up going over the routed control plane instead of the routed? I.e it knows only the host part of the fqdn, and does a lookup in based on it's own view of the world where internalapi is .internalapi.cloudname. The lookup would be compute_roleB_01.internalapi.cloudname returning the ctplane IP? (Maby this is'nt really a problem)


I guess what I am wondering is if using different network's for the same service net is a flawed approach. Something I am working on fixing by making each composable network able to support multiple subnets here: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/tripleo-routed-networks-templates+(status:open)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-10-15 11:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:40:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> We would end up with firewall rules on different roles only allowing trafic from nodes on the same network?

In my routed deployment (without this patch), where computeovsdpdk is in a different L2 network, here are the values of snmpd_network
[root@overcloud-computeovsdpdk-0 heat-admin]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml snmpd_network 
192.168.11.15/24
[root@overcloud-controller-0 heat-admin]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml snmpd_network                                                                                                       
192.168.10.25/24

So it is already having different rules on different roles. I understand the issue you are highlighting, it should be addressed, probably will raise a bug to look in to it.

> The lookup would be compute_roleB_01.internalapi.cloudname returning the ctplane IP? (Maby this is'nt really a problem)

I understand what you are referring, is that an issue in hosts to have an entry for un-relevant network? like compute_roleB has InternalApi1 and not InternalApi, in which case compute_roleB_01.internalapi.cloudname entry on hosts is invalid, though we are mapping unknown networks to ControlPlane, ideally those entry should not be presenet.


> Something I am working on fixing by making each composable network able to support multiple subnets here: 
 https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/tripleo-routed-networks-templates+(status:open)

This looks more appropriate than having multiple networks for same network type (like InternalApi). And internally subnets can isolate different networks. And this will solve the routed network issue of associating appropriate network to the services, as the network will be same but IP will be different based on the node and subnet. 

Once we have network_data_subnets_routed.yaml, then we could remove network_data_routed.yaml too, which makes more sense. As of now, I don't see a value in this patch as multiple subnet will solve the issue. I will abandon it until we see a real need.

@Steven, Thanks for the reviews, next time, i will ensure that i provide the relevant context on the patch. Just FYI, this patch is (may be was) trying to remove this workaround in the routed network deployment with multiple networks: 

  ComputeOvsDpdkExtraConfig:
    nova::vncproxy::host: "%{hiera('internal_api1')}"
    neutron::agents::ml2::ovs::local_ip: "%{hiera('tenant1')}"'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-10-16 07:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Provide network name associated with the role to ServiceNetMap

name of the custom network, associated with the role. Updated the
ServiceNetMap to support role specific merging.

[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:52:32.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I567b7fb703f095c9ac7c7732dfc1ac8b9a7b9cf7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-01 15:34:05.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I567b7fb703f095c9ac7c7732dfc1ac8b9a7b9cf7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I567b7fb703f095c9ac7c7732dfc1ac8b9a7b9cf7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Add wmi job terminate timeout cfg opt
messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-10-04 09:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-10-16 07:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 09:22:29.000000000', 'message': "Add wmi job terminate timeout cfg opt

We're using a hardcoded 15 seconds timeout when canceling WMI jobs.

Some jobs may not be cancelable, some may take longer to stop. For
example, Nova instances may end up in error state after attempting
to delete them as this hardcoded timeout gets exceeded.

That being considered, we're now adding a config option for this,
also increasing the default timeout to 2 minutes.

Ideally, Nova should pass a timeout here. Still, by adding a config
option at the os-win level, it's easier to backport this to older
releases, also providing a default for any kind of WMI job.

Change-Id: I797366c40a3a4bb74fe925bd10697f227e22915c
Closes-Bug: #1790890
(cherry picked from commit 11e28563d4ffacfeb1a65b55b5fe792c61e7d0e4)
(cherry picked from commit fc4f6c916ce99d7f6ff9e38eb67fc78915983fa1)
"}]
commit_message:
Add wmi job terminate timeout cfg opt

We're using a hardcoded 15 seconds timeout when canceling WMI jobs.

Some jobs may not be cancelable, some may take longer to stop. For
example, Nova instances may end up in error state after attempting
to delete them as this hardcoded timeout gets exceeded.

That being considered, we're now adding a config option for this,
also increasing the default timeout to 2 minutes.

Ideally, Nova should pass a timeout here. Still, by adding a config
option at the os-win level, it's easier to backport this to older
releases, also providing a default for any kind of WMI job.

Change-Id: I797366c40a3a4bb74fe925bd10697f227e22915c
Closes-Bug: #1790890
(cherry picked from commit 11e28563d4ffacfeb1a65b55b5fe792c61e7d0e4)
(cherry picked from commit fc4f6c916ce99d7f6ff9e38eb67fc78915983fa1)

commit_message:
Allow enabling metrics per virtual disk

This change will allow enabling metrics for individual virtual disks.
The Nova Hyper-V driver will use it when attaching Cinder volumes.

Note that Hyper-V does not support collecting metrics for passthrough
disks at the moment.

Change-Id: Iaba32ca94b2c09661f150fa4b12b2c7eb83ff6d9
Partial-Bug: #1794456
(cherry picked from commit a0b64b654406b415dc13eff9837d418d22116776)
(cherry picked from commit 51b3045dbae8b57bc1540f37391a2602095cd280)

commit_message:
Fix port metrics

At the moment, port metrics are not enabled. The reason is that we're
using the wrong switch port WMI class.

This issue went more or less unnoticed, especially due to the fact that
we're currently ignoring the according WMI method return code.

This change ensures that port metrics are properly enabled and that an
exception will be raised when failing to do so.

Closes-Bug: #1794291

Change-Id: I8086e7dd9e134749760b05469f5b2c8bcfdcdbde
(cherry picked from commit 865c1cfaa0e6984b87fe1a0c45cbe611f85a4a3b)
(cherry picked from commit 77c6d80b57391e6c0851ec170e77860195b0dc6d)

[{'created': '2018-10-04 09:22:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect numeric comparisons

In a few places, we're using "is" or "is not", when comparing
numeric variables.

This is incorrect and will give unexpected results when the types
do not match (for example, if one of the variables is a long int):

This change fixes those comparisons.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect numeric comparisons

In a few places, we're using "is" or "is not", when comparing
numeric variables.

This is incorrect and will give unexpected results when the types
do not match (for example, if one of the variables is a long int):
http://paste.openstack.org/raw/730618/

This change fixes those comparisons.

Closes-Bug: #1794068

Change-Id: Ibf28778879050cfdfa82ef4f9b587170dde6203f
(cherry picked from commit 1f8200ef7909b13adf501f2805554160fa934f3a)
(cherry picked from commit 59e1117506067f42cec30e0eae6c7e92ffb0b6bc)

commit_message:
Ignore events for unnamed VM vNICs

VM vNIC names are mandatory. Still, we'll getting events for unnamed ports,
breaking os-win consumers.

We'll ignore those events, logging a warning.

Change-Id: I58a408b33a590b9c1ca3d8f32fa3c4d027f43381
Closes-Bug: #1761748
(cherry picked from commit 42cfab1081dcb46b7dca898316fb095206b78666)
(cherry picked from commit 5ba1e81cd1f82859058178ebb9183c3e9ccf17d8)

commit_message:
Add method for retrieving VM nics

We need a way to retrieve VM nic names. This will allow the Nova
Hyper-V driver to enable port metrics when receiving instance power
on events.

It's safer to query Hyper-V directly rather than relying on Nova's port
cache.

Change-Id: Ibe7409b392b91204f0cea2bdd32c86ec03d06b67
Partial-Bug: #1794456
(cherry picked from commit c73b074042d7122e6019601a3dcbd94d4f4e3d8f)
(cherry picked from commit e3cc6d468976c3642732e2ee94ccdfe45370df5e)

commit_message:
Update subnode repos for mixed_upgrades jobs.

Currently, this vxlan_networking step is failing in all
mixed_upgrades jobs, as the respositories are not being
set up in the subnode-1 due to different releases being
deployed in the undercloud and overcloud. This causes
having an old ovs version installed in the subnode that
makes the vxlan_networking script fail.

Change-Id: I58d3cd2c6f1443276cee3f8e70235b7f81ed0999
Closes-Bug: #1791115

commit_message:
Add introspection rules actions to add/remove traits on nodes

Otherwise it's not possible to modify them, since they're not updated
via the regular node updating mechanism.

Change-Id: I338015ff9dafe07f4e70a23ddcf6cd488eda9907
Story: #2003788
Task: #26496

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-01 07:01:59.000000000', 'message': "Make update_status use synchronized_zone

There is a race condition when adding a new recordset to a zone
and when central is processing the update_status from a previous
recordset/zone operation. In the subsequent recordset operation,
central fails to update the zone's action/status in DB to UPDATE/PENDING.
It remains as NONE/ACTIVE, and worker error's out.

Each operation retrieves a different copy in memory of the Zone object
(when it calls self.storage.get_zone). As a result this does not update
the obj_changes field for the zone object for the latter operation.
Therefore the DB update doesn't update any values.

update_status should be synchronized as it updates zone DB

Change-Id: Ib4e0bc567ba8eb54c61c3921d165521bf2f12206
Closes-Bug: #1713875
(cherry picked from commit 12cd654b143e215dbe01cc2688a7d6e6cf3ce62f)
"}, {'created': '2018-10-01 15:06:32.000000000', 'message': "Make update_status use synchronized_zone

There is a race condition when adding a new recordset to a zone
and when central is processing the update_status from a previous
recordset/zone operation. In the subsequent recordset operation,
central fails to update the zone's action/status in DB to UPDATE/PENDING.
It remains as NONE/ACTIVE, and worker error's out.

Each operation retrieves a different copy in memory of the Zone object
(when it calls self.storage.get_zone). As a result this does not update
the obj_changes field for the zone object for the latter operation.
Therefore the DB update doesn't update any values.

update_status should be synchronized as it updates zone DB

Change-Id: Ib4e0bc567ba8eb54c61c3921d165521bf2f12206
Closes-Bug: #1713875
(cherry picked from commit 12cd654b143e215dbe01cc2688a7d6e6cf3ce62f)
"}]
commit_message:
Make update_status use synchronized_zone

There is a race condition when adding a new recordset to a zone
and when central is processing the update_status from a previous
recordset/zone operation. In the subsequent recordset operation,
central fails to update the zone's action/status in DB to UPDATE/PENDING.
It remains as NONE/ACTIVE, and worker error's out.

Each operation retrieves a different copy in memory of the Zone object
(when it calls self.storage.get_zone). As a result this does not update
the obj_changes field for the zone object for the latter operation.
Therefore the DB update doesn't update any values.

update_status should be synchronized as it updates zone DB

Change-Id: Ib4e0bc567ba8eb54c61c3921d165521bf2f12206
Closes-Bug: #1713875
(cherry picked from commit 12cd654b143e215dbe01cc2688a7d6e6cf3ce62f)

commit_message:
Ensure the needed openshift resources are set

We expect the the Keepalived and HAproxy services to be deployed on the
OpenShift master nodes, let's require them in the openshift heat
environment file. This prevents an issue when the docker-ha environment
is loaded because it would redefine these resources.

Change-Id: I57a7ea854bd8db4e20af1a608a6937604c0e3bd2

commit_message:
Refactor the AAP driver to not depend on nova

Replace calls to the nova client with calls to the compute driver.
This will help non vm efforts (e.g. zune) and also make the code
easier to break up later.

Change-Id: I7ee175c5ecb98af0ca5e299c2ac10e43eb40ed30

[{'created': '2018-10-15 20:45:50.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce gate window floor to 10

Both the tripleo gate and the openstack integrated gate are incredibly
flaky and they use up a good deal of test nodes. To mitigate the impact
of this on the check queue and for people not working on either set of
queues reduce the window floor to 10 from 20.

Change-Id: I05aa65a132c272ad6bf60e44c82e0dd24b53bb8b
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce gate window floor to 10

Both the tripleo gate and the openstack integrated gate are incredibly
flaky and they use up a good deal of test nodes. To mitigate the impact
of this on the check queue and for people not working on either set of
queues reduce the window floor to 10 from 20.

Change-Id: I05aa65a132c272ad6bf60e44c82e0dd24b53bb8b

Neutron-LBaaS to Octavia migration tool

This patch adds a tool that migrates running load balancers from Neutron-LBaaS
to Octavia.

Task: 5161

upgrades.

'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Id29359e81c002cc302b81a8779f363a4a2ba5474
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic34638ac84c26e6563d24c67c6e6179b901a616a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Cleanup the osquery tooling and vendor roles
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-10-16 03:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-10-16 03:47:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-10-16 04:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 03:43:25.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup the osquery tooling and vendor roles

The osquery tooling needed a little work to be fully automated and
repeatable. This change tunes up the tools and makes the entire
deployment process multi-node capable and repeatable.

Change-Id: I88c2b40ed9d9a88a39bdf07b0dce2900fda50151
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-16 03:47:55.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup the osquery tooling and vendor roles

The osquery tooling needed a little work to be fully automated and
repeatable. This change tunes up the tools and makes the entire
deployment process multi-node capable and repeatable.

The osquery role was vendored because of bugs within their use of aarmor
profiles and there was no way to disable them.

The fleet use of commands for ssl creation have been removed. The ssl
modules are now being used to generate all of the certificates.

New pre-tasks have been added to check for required variables. If the
required variables are not set the playbooks will fail early and notify
the user of the issue.

Change-Id: I88c2b40ed9d9a88a39bdf07b0dce2900fda50151
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup the osquery tooling and vendor roles

The osquery tooling needed a little work to be fully automated and
repeatable. This change tunes up the tools and makes the entire
deployment process multi-node capable and repeatable.

The osquery role was vendored because of bugs within their use of aarmor
profiles and there was no way to disable them.

The fleet use of commands for ssl creation have been removed. The ssl
modules are now being used to generate all of the certificates.

New pre-tasks have been added to check for required variables. If the
required variables are not set the playbooks will fail early and notify
the user of the issue.

Change-Id: I88c2b40ed9d9a88a39bdf07b0dce2900fda50151
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:47:42.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic8908b62412a608f6b3b4c4e69940871a812d3a4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic8908b62412a608f6b3b4c4e69940871a812d3a4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
use retry_if_session_inactive from neutron-lib

The retry_if_session_inactive decorator was rehomed into neutron-lib
[1]. This patch consumes it by using neutron-libs version where
appropriate in prep for [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557040/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607710/

Change-Id: Icbcabfef0892504eae45babdf82405d39a3acd42

commit_message:
Support API version discovery

This commit adds version discovery when user doesn't explicitly request
a version or request the latest version. The latest version means
the most recently version between server and client.

Change-Id: I17be26342add9e9f4e3c384cc4aad613902e04a9
Implements: blueprint api-version-negotiation

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-22 10:52:57.000000000', 'message': "Turn down stevedore and urllib logging

Having stevedore logging set to debug makes actual debug output almost
useless, and it's never interesting logging for openstacksdk.

enable_logging should do the most expected and useful thing. If someone
wants to use openstacksdk in debug mode and see stevedore debug
messages, the full power of python logging is available to them.

Change-Id: I4cd7e6eb06081768afbc077e5bda397e6ae13e1b
"}]
commit_message:
Turn down stevedore and urllib logging

Having stevedore logging set to debug makes actual debug output almost
useless, and it's never interesting logging for openstacksdk.

enable_logging should do the most expected and useful thing. If someone
wants to use openstacksdk in debug mode and see stevedore debug
messages, the full power of python logging is available to them.

Change-Id: I4cd7e6eb06081768afbc077e5bda397e6ae13e1b

commit_message:
Getting conductor host with the command get-conductor-host <node uuid>

Ironic conductor and its manage node was connected with hash,
sometime we need to know this connection, this function is aiming
to show the hash connection with the command
get-conductor-host <node uuid>.

Change-Id: I5f6534c6fd3d61db1542d47e18ee800eeda59818
Story: #2003805
Task: #26548

[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:47:44.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I4bb873290a84cdc4d07d6cb14bb9ef80d151b435
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I4bb873290a84cdc4d07d6cb14bb9ef80d151b435
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add tempest test for legacy API version

Currently, the container test cases requires API version 1.20
or higher. This commit adds legacy test class to cover
API version 1.19 or lower.

Change-Id: I5e5f23ceab5438f6025beb9dc6ac1ffebd33f9a9

commit_message:
Completely remove support for deprecated Glance V1

Also removes support for having several API versions for the Image
API. We do not do it for Neutron and Swift. And if we ever support
the (hypothetical) Glance V3 API, we better do it transparently,
not with a configuration option (maybe using openstacksdk).
Cleans up Glance V1 specific features like image.is_public or
a separate image.properties field.

The code should be consolidated into fewer modules in a follow-up.

Story: #1670423
Task: #26830
Change-Id: I08a01eadbe8a2dec4c02674bed0391846632ef06

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 14:17:43.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify group-mapping example in docs

The mapping example adds mapped users to a group, so it is misleading to
say that it grants them a role directly, which is the purview of
autoprovisioning. This patch clarifies that, and also updates the role
name to be `reader` which is the new default read-only role.

Followup to https://review.openstack.org/605496

Change-Id: I669df0800275c49ed1ec2c3934301313fb7c4dca
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify group-mapping example in docs

The mapping example adds mapped users to a group, so it is misleading to
say that it grants them a role directly, which is the purview of
autoprovisioning. This patch clarifies that, and also updates the role
name to be `reader` which is the new default read-only role.

Followup to https://review.openstack.org/605496

Change-Id: I669df0800275c49ed1ec2c3934301313fb7c4dca

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Iba03e851d112e11fbad3acc38aa395302a8b40b2
Story: #2004073
Task: #27446
