commit_message:
Not able to upload volume to image

upload_to_image() function should be updated when
client version is bigger than 3.1.

Without this we are not able to run this function:

   image = cinder_client.volumes.upload_to_image(
       volume=temporary_volume,
       force=True,
       image_name='temporary_image_of_{0}'.format(temporary_volume.id),
       container_format="bare",
       disk_format="raw"
   )

Change-Id: I825ad0d6f6c25e2d85c756e6148e73e7e298ef75
Closes-Bug: #1787399
Co-Authored-By: Jiao Pengju <jiaopengju@cmss.chinamobile.com>

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ie4d7cca55c1c5211c67c151763e1a1ef95f5337b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-12 11:49:54.000000000', 'message': "Disable Swift auditors/replicators on undercloud

Maintain parity with instack-undercloud
Ic93082282e9ea481c13832f8ce1265a47f0ef3d5

Swift is using only a single replica on the undercloud. Therefore
recovering from a corrupted or lost object is not possible, and running
replicators and auditors only wastes resources. And may create some
trouble. For example, the DB replicators and auditors will lock the DB,
and new objects won't be stored during that time.

Related-Bug: #1632885
Closes-Bug: #1797167

commit_message:
Disable Swift auditors/replicators on undercloud

Maintain parity with instack-undercloud
Ic93082282e9ea481c13832f8ce1265a47f0ef3d5

Swift is using only a single replica on the undercloud. Therefore
recovering from a corrupted or lost object is not possible, and running
replicators and auditors only wastes resources. And may create some
trouble. For example, the DB replicators and auditors will lock the DB,
and new objects won't be stored during that time.

Related-Bug: #1632885
Closes-Bug: #1797167

Change-Id: I584cdb03b99721fbdc28bf7f6019d914586341d2
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

i'm hesitant to go back to the model of adding hieradata to the inventory. we did a fair amount of work to get rid of all that due to various issues, and chose instead to use host_vars/group_vars files.

I think it was somewhat of an ansible anti-pattern doing what we were before with all the hieradata in the inventory.

The inventory is still useful on its own without these vars, just not for a TripleO overcloud deployment, which is ok I think. So we ought to be able to also write this data out via host_vars/group_vars in the config_download code?"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-10-05 08:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@slagle thanks for the feedback - FYI my motivation is to allow consumption of the per-service bootstrap node names in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605430/

I think having ansible shell out to hiera is also a pretty bad pattern, so somehow we need those variables accessible via ansible vars.

I'll take a look at the host_vars approach, I don't have a strong opinion on how the vars get set - I guess we could just have a group vars file for the entire "overcloud" group e.g all nodes?

I'll WIP this until I've had time to try that and/or we've discussed this further.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-10-05 08:52:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-10-05 09:49:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-10-05 13:43:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > opinion on how the vars get set - I guess we could just have a
 > group vars file for the entire "overcloud" group e.g all nodes?

It would be kind of like this:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596429 (and the depends-on)

that was a way to set group_vars per service and have them rendered in the group_vars dir during config-download.

It'd be a similar approach where you'd read this stack output in the config-download code and write it out to an "overcloud" (or other group name) under group_vars/.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-10-10 11:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add AllNodesConfig to config-download group vars

Since I7b865bf82520006eef3ac2f36df34b1f3c34e642 added an AllNodesConfig
output to the overcloud, we can consume that in the group_vars
and add it to the main overcloud group which means the data will be
available to all overcloud nodes.

This may be helpful to solve issues resolving per-service bootstrap
nodes, and also the data there may be more generally useful in
ansible tasks.

Partial-Bug: #1792613
Depends-On: I7b865bf82520006eef3ac2f36df34b1f3c34e642
Change-Id: Idcee177b21e85cff9e0bf10f4c43c71eff9364ec

oslo.messaging has removed rpc_backend in commit
d3f6ca0b47e2a5a3413b27617d9655f02b191c6a, use transport_url instead.

Change-Id: Ic51c79c0c0a1338e7a8fab998ceb6413de18920a
Closes-Bug: #1797781

[{'created': '2018-10-09 14:42:37.000000000', 'message': 'check mode: puppet host

Adds check mode support for puppet host tasks.

This works by writing the new puppet host manifest under
/var/lib/tripleo-config/check-mode, and diffing it against the existing
version of the manifest.

Puppet is also run with --noop, so that it only reports on what changes
would have been made.

It also uses the check mode hiera configuration at
/etc/puppet/check-mode/hiera.yaml if it exists so that the updated hiera
data is also accounted for when puppet runs with --noop.

Depends-On: Ibe0c2ab79c35f04ce51e7a1ade0e8ff72b430163

(cherry picked from commit 6d0f16d4303e1b99e72a0c16932c92c912df61ed)

commit_message:
check mode: puppet host

Adds check mode support for puppet host tasks.

This works by writing the new puppet host manifest under
/var/lib/tripleo-config/check-mode, and diffing it against the existing
version of the manifest.

Puppet is also run with --noop, so that it only reports on what changes
would have been made.

It also uses the check mode hiera configuration at
/etc/puppet/check-mode/hiera.yaml if it exists so that the updated hiera
data is also accounted for when puppet runs with --noop.

Depends-On: Ibe0c2ab79c35f04ce51e7a1ade0e8ff72b430163
Change-Id: I112b63096c8dce05176b0939a7678bec02987294
(cherry picked from commit 6d0f16d4303e1b99e72a0c16932c92c912df61ed)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 11:31:54.000000000', 'message': "Convert with_dict tasks to use loop and be less chatty

with_dict is replaced by ansible's loop:
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_loops.html#with-dict

This migrates tasks using with_dict over to use loop instead.

Additionally, when using loop (or with_dict), the entire loop item is
logged by default. This makes these tasks very verbose since we're
looping over large json/yaml files. Instead, use loop_control and label
ot only log the item key. The entire data structure already exists in
the config-download directory anyway, so there's no need to log the
whole thing to the console.

Change-Id: I1fc7431dfc662212b6ca64f4f738760f25b0c30b
(cherry picked from commit 1b0c827930866538a8d1cae91f1c31bbd09b4199)
"}]
commit_message:
Convert with_dict tasks to use loop and be less chatty

with_dict is replaced by ansible's loop:
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_loops.html#with-dict

This migrates tasks using with_dict over to use loop instead.

Additionally, when using loop (or with_dict), the entire loop item is
logged by default. This makes these tasks very verbose since we're
looping over large json/yaml files. Instead, use loop_control and label
ot only log the item key. The entire data structure already exists in
the config-download directory anyway, so there's no need to log the
whole thing to the console.

Change-Id: I1fc7431dfc662212b6ca64f4f738760f25b0c30b
(cherry picked from commit 1b0c827930866538a8d1cae91f1c31bbd09b4199)

[{'account_id': 27471, 'date': '2018-02-09 02:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-09 02:02:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-02-09 02:51:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Update deployment status when deploying or failed

There were a couple spots where the deployment status was not properly
updated. The first was when the stack failed, the deployment status also
needed to be set to failed.

The second is when we start the config_download process, the status
needs to be set to deploying.

Depends-On: I87b97bcab3e8cec6bdbb79c0acb95a375bb2d2fa
Change-Id: Ida519df829450c1ce9216049d76bc098176c273b
Closes-Bug: #1795640

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 22:33:53.000000000', 'message': "ensure the correct volume is deleted

Author: Jay Rubenstein jay.rubenstein@netapp.com
Date: 2018-07-18 11:42 -0600

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the
returned object/volumes-id matchs the requested volume-id with a
comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

pep8 tabs to space changes

Closes-Bug: #1782373
Change-Id: I92a8e76c64c4e23dd185875e009132938ace5091
"}, {'created': '2018-09-19 21:56:33.000000000', 'message': "SF ensure the correct volume is deleted

 sf_vid variable value is not assigned when provider_id is None due to

 this has been changed to correctly deal with the no provider_id case

commit_message:
SF ensure the correct volume is deleted

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the
returned object/volumes-id matchs the requested volume-id with a
comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

Closes-Bug: #1782373
Change-Id: I92a8e76c64c4e23dd185875e009132938ace5091

[Documentation] Make featureset numbers links to the definition.

This is based on feedback saying that the featureset definitions could
be easier to find this way.

Change-Id: I01b73a0ddbb7a5cc76af1a483c6d4c25ec2f5629

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated version of enable_logging

The openstack.utils.enable_logging method has been deprecated since
0.10 and is slated for removal. Update senlin to consume it from the new
location.

Change-Id: I01b73a0ddbb7a5cc76af1a483c6d4c25ec2f5629

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version
on Xenial, now that we have Bionic Beaver nodes
that support python3.7, lets switch to testing
with python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in
Stein and beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: Ia9868f39ff788e02850fae756820f7c1388bde0a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609832/
Story: #2004073
Task: #27427

commit_message:
Use l3plugin property in neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py module

Class DVRResourceOperationHandler has got property called
l3plugin which returns directory.get_plugin(plugin_constants.L3)
so there is no need to use directory.get_plugin(plugin_constants.L3)
in other places in this class.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Externalize some repo URL vars to allow runtime modification

This is to be able to use local mirror of certain packages.

Change-Id: Ia06c6df0628ce5a44ed072c875eaa65d1343c65d

commit_message:
Un-deprecate the nova-consoleauth service

The nova-consoleauth service was erroneously deprecated in Rocky even
though it is still required by nova-api. Console token auths are being
stored in both nova-consoleauth _and_ the database in Rocky.

This is a partial revert to remove "deprecation" language from the
following commits:

  * c53c9ea759462c0294775562b81df7cba9fa2027
  * f0d2925bc71d0649f75fd3d281742f2e56e7e3b6
  * 8bb8045b590fc562a2a5221119f100c8695835f5
  * 969239029d4a13956747e6e0b850d6c6ab4035f0

Closes-Bug: #1793255

Change-Id: Ie6542c1b1b681c5fce6b24c3e09b8fe18b8c3a8c
(cherry picked from commit 473fd0d548170dc7499d28746603ec9ab5b22b80)

[{'created': '2018-10-01 20:08:14.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Deprecate the nova-consoleauth service"

This reverts commit e91dad3ee93b1c0c4201e1e679a8c5b333879b5f.

The release notes said it was okay not to run the nova-consoleauth
service in Rocky, but that's not true because the Rocky code is storing
new console authorization tokens in both the database backend and the
existing nova-consoleauth backend. The use of nova-consoleauth will be
discontinued in Stein (for non-cells v1). We can't remove
nova-consoleauth until we remove cells v1.

Partial-Bug: #1788470

 Conflicts:
    api-guide/source/general_info.rst
    releasenotes/notes/deprecate-nova-consoleauth-ed6ccbc324a0fb10.yaml

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are due to the fact that the nova-ec2
service no longer exists in the api-guide and the release note had
been modified in 4f01f4ff88de571218a36ba7c4e998296a7b52a4 after being
added in e91dad3ee93b1c0c4201e1e679a8c5b333879b5f.

Change-Id: Ic7a89aa23a2ea247792186bad32d0d37c17de6af
(cherry picked from commit ec3c6dbb976723314867422b4ce317a00f13e87e)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Deprecate the nova-consoleauth service"

This reverts commit e91dad3ee93b1c0c4201e1e679a8c5b333879b5f.

The release notes said it was okay not to run the nova-consoleauth
service in Rocky, but that's not true because the Rocky code is storing
new console authorization tokens in both the database backend and the
existing nova-consoleauth backend. The use of nova-consoleauth will be
discontinued in Stein (for non-cells v1). We can't remove
nova-consoleauth until we remove cells v1.

Partial-Bug: #1788470

 Conflicts:
    api-guide/source/general_info.rst
    releasenotes/notes/deprecate-nova-consoleauth-ed6ccbc324a0fb10.yaml

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are due to the fact that the nova-ec2
service no longer exists in the api-guide and the release note had
been modified in 4f01f4ff88de571218a36ba7c4e998296a7b52a4 after being
added in e91dad3ee93b1c0c4201e1e679a8c5b333879b5f.

Change-Id: Ic7a89aa23a2ea247792186bad32d0d37c17de6af
(cherry picked from commit ec3c6dbb976723314867422b4ce317a00f13e87e)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2018-10-05 11:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Use tempest-pg-full

The legacy job legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-pg-full is now named
tempest-pg-full - using the new tempest and Zuul v3 frameworks.

Change experimental job to use new job.

Change-Id: I40c93dbb863497173b097ba9112cbaf107d8232c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/609530

[{'created': '2018-09-14 20:58:41.000000000', 'message': 'An execution hangs in the RUNNING state after rerun

When we rerun an execution we must create the "_check_and_complete"
delayed calls for all parent workflows. The problem was that we created
the delayed call only for the rerun execution and its parent.

Recursive rerun was extracted in the separated function. Because we
need to execute some additional operations, for example, create delayed
call for every a rerun execution.

Change-Id: I530094e916daf25bb9c672c445afa980ad4311ae
Closes-Bug: #1792451
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

Recursive rerun was extracted in the separated function. Because we
need to execute some additional operations, for example, create delayed

Change-Id: I530094e916daf25bb9c672c445afa980ad4311ae
Closes-Bug: #1792451

'}]
commit_message:
An execution hangs in the RUNNING state after rerun

When we rerun an execution we must create the "_check_and_complete"
delayed calls for all parent workflows. The problem was that we created
the delayed call only for the rerun execution and its parent.

Recursive rerun was extracted in the separated function. Because we
need to execute some additional operations, for example, create delayed
call for every a rerun execution.

Change-Id: I530094e916daf25bb9c672c445afa980ad4311ae
Closes-Bug: #1792451
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I430b624962bd476e4d2efadd6ef93738e78eee8e
Story: #2004073
Task: #27455

[{'created': '2018-10-10 16:14:45.000000000', 'message': 'Handle not having cinderclient.v1 available

The Cinder v1 API was deprecated several years ago and may be removed
from python-cinderclient in the near future. To handle the case where v1

without it and give an appropriate error if v1 is requested with a

commit_message:
Handle not having cinderclient.v1 available

The Cinder v1 API was deprecated several years ago and may be removed
from python-cinderclient in the near future. To handle the case where v1
is no longer present, this updates cinderclient initialization to work
without it and give an appropriate error if v1 is requested with a
version where it is no longer available.

Change-Id: I277d7b48b8ad4cce383ec3722f8117938378f615
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ceph-client: make pool creation depedent on ceph-mgr service

This is to add dependency for pool creation untill ceph-mgr fully up.

Change-Id: Id3111810a855bedff62970091b225358c269cecd

messages:
[{'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-10-11 06:00:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-11 08:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-10-11 12:23:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The _policy module in neutron-lib isn't used by consumers nor is it ready to be used. That's why it's private "_policy".

With that in mind I think this needs to go into neutron at this point. When we get the policy module ready for consumption in lib we'll have to make sure it's updated and in sync with neutrons.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-10-11 12:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Boden, it is used, I tried to make changes to oslo.policy and stumbled with failures regarding this module. This is how I ended up making this change.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-10-11 12:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

boden: http://logs.openstack.org/07/577807/24/check/tempest-full-py3/d04ebd7/controller/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz#_Oct_11_07_38_37_447190'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-10-15 12:54:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't understand how it could be used based on [1].

In either case the module is not ready for consumption; that's why it's private. IMO we should not be using it until someone makes sure its up to date, makes it public and consumes it in neutron and other projects.



[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron_lib%20import%20_policy&i=nope&files=&repos="}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-10-15 12:55:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

BTW; the usage you pointed me to in the logs appears to be from neutron_lib using it's own _policy module... No one outside of neutron-lib is using it; hence my statement about it not being used (by consumers)."}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-10-15 13:00:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Sorry I misunderstood the problem; you are trying to fix this internal use of the _policy.


Is there a bug report we can link to here?'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2018-10-15 17:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-10-15 19:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2018-10-11 06:00:01.000000000', 'message': "Use authorize instead of enforce in policy

the policy module was doing a manual check to see if the specific rule
was actually part of the rules that the enforcer is using. oslo.policy
already has a function that does just this, which is 'authorize'. That
will check the registered rules and raise an exception if that's not
fulfilled.

Change-Id: I9f04f8b8770b15ac24f9f1cd57a58c7e98b24d48
"}]
commit_message:
Use authorize instead of enforce in policy

the policy module was doing a manual check to see if the specific rule
was actually part of the rules that the enforcer is using. oslo.policy
already has a function that does just this, which is 'authorize'. That
will check the registered rules and raise an exception if that's not
fulfilled.

Change-Id: I9f04f8b8770b15ac24f9f1cd57a58c7e98b24d48

commit_message:
Reject actions if target resource is locked

- If an action targets a cluster or node that is already locked, reject
  the action with 409 error.
- Added simulated wait time option to nova test driver to allow tempest
  to test resource locked exception.

Implements: blueprint fail-fast-locked-resource
Change-Id: I27b6996c65ffd1777dad5047f869596373e693c7

[{'created': '2018-10-15 16:34:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix venv target for creating release notes

Without doc/requirements.txt in the venv target you
can't create release notes by doing:

  tox -e venv -- reno new <slug>

This fixes the venv target dependencies to do that.

Change-Id: Ia4b0311755fe30a79bdb529dcea4ae21efd57c8a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix venv target for creating release notes

Without doc/requirements.txt in the venv target you
can't create release notes by doing:

  tox -e venv -- reno new <slug>

This fixes the venv target dependencies to do that.

Change-Id: Ia4b0311755fe30a79bdb529dcea4ae21efd57c8a

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I93af9d7fc8605a751dfc017b818bbb6d5691a83c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-05 15:07:09.000000000', 'message': "devstack: fix sample config files to correctly setup gq chassis

When deploying multinode environments with devstack using sample
config files, all nodes were eligible to host a gateway but normally
only one would have external connectivity. This would lead to
some gateways being unreachable.

This patch is setting the 'enable-chassis-as-gw' in the default
sample file and leave it disabled in the compute one. This way,
gateways will be scheduled only on master nodes where external
connectivity is assumed.

Change-Id: I3671b2cd57daa0bc2851a287e6cd88c142b45e41
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
devstack: fix sample config files to correctly setup gq chassis

When deploying multinode environments with devstack using sample
config files, all nodes were eligible to host a gateway but normally
only one would have external connectivity. This would lead to
some gateways being unreachable.

This patch is setting the 'enable-chassis-as-gw' in the default
sample file and leave it disabled in the compute one. This way,
gateways will be scheduled only on master nodes where external
connectivity is assumed.

Change-Id: I3671b2cd57daa0bc2851a287e6cd88c142b45e41
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Implements: liquidio-containerization

Modified Liquidio puppet module for containerization support.
These changes would support both baremetal and container based
deployments.

commit_message:
Fix nova-api healthcheck in case of nova metadata wsgi

While we have a dedicated nova_metadata healthcheck script, the
nova_metadata and nova_api use the same container image and the current
nova api healtcheck script still checks the non wsgi implementation. This
changes the nova_api healthcheck script to check the metadata wsgi vhost
config for details instead of the details in nova.conf.

Change-Id: I028caee75e47618d5d0c55054ef33216d05d41b6
Closes-Bug: #1797514

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:47:33.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I8521c3ef4baf1d8fe866ec26d7558088cbd75cc9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I8521c3ef4baf1d8fe866ec26d7558088cbd75cc9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix error in Tenant network routes definition

Deploying with network_data_routed.yaml is throwing
'Unknown Property ip_netmask' for the Tenant network routes.
Fix the network_data_routed.yaml definition to use the
right keys for the route definition.

Change-Id: Ied81ed342dbeb026225b01aeed66aca7411b3555
(cherry picked from commit 00652b65960b34ae101a0e4152dec1dd40093d1d)

'}, {'created': '2018-10-12 19:52:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix for grenade slow discovery of e1000 network device

Ironic Inspector grenade job is using e1000 driver since
change: I4ec297281380896ffe9004c4de7117586ded7149

In some cases the e1000 devices has not registered yet,
and thus the dhcp init script does not find any interfaces
to bring up. This causes the grenade job to continue with
no network, and the job finally fail.

Add a check in the tinyipa dhcp init script, if no network
devices are present. Re-run udevadm --settle with a longer
timout and the re-discover devices in /proc/net/dev.

Let's hope another 5 seconds is enough. If not we now have
more logs to identify the issue.

Change-Id: I82beecc78afb4b23234d2d5eca4f46f84f20525e

Ironic Inspector grenade job is using e1000 driver since
change: I4ec297281380896ffe9004c4de7117586ded7149

In some cases the e1000 devices has not registered yet,
and thus the dhcp init script does not find any interfaces
to bring up. This causes the grenade job to continue with
no networking, and the job finally fail.

Make the udev settle timout configurable (default 20 sec)
in finalise-tinyipa.sh.

Let's hope 20 seconds is enough. If not we now have more
logs to identify the issue.

Change-Id: I82beecc78afb4b23234d2d5eca4f46f84f20525e
"}]
commit_message:
Raise udevadm settle timeout from 5 to 20 seconds

To fix for grenade slow discovery of e1000 network devices.

Ironic Inspector grenade job is using e1000 driver since
change: I4ec297281380896ffe9004c4de7117586ded7149

In some cases the e1000 devices has not registered yet,
and thus the dhcp init script does not find any interfaces
to bring up. This causes the grenade job to continue with
no networking, and the job finally fail.

Make the udev settle timout configurable (default 20 sec)
in finalise-tinyipa.sh.

Let's hope 20 seconds is enough. If not we now have more
logs to identify the issue.

Change-Id: I82beecc78afb4b23234d2d5eca4f46f84f20525e

commit_message:
Expand implied roles in system-scoped tokens

The implementation for system-scoped tokens lacked support for
expanding implied roles. This patch modifies the token model so that
it generates implied roles on the system in the token response.

Change-Id: I46ff38a9cff6c605ccb9a52b1533f01fa4faec17
Closes-Bug: 1788694

commit_message:
Add test case for expanding implied roles in system tokens

If a user has a role assignment on the system, which implies another
role assignment, the system-scoped token response should include
both role assignments.

This patch exposes a bug in the system-scoped token implementation
where implied roles aren't expanded out before returning the
token response to the user.

Change-Id: I176bbbda9658a54f6873a4009938f140a5b1a33e
Related-Bug: 1788694

commit_message:
Move loadapp to a generic place

This commit moves loadapp to BaseTestCase so that it can be
used by test classes inheriting from BaseTestCase without having
to invoke all the extra stuff from TestCase.

Change-Id: Ida1e7b65a5d88e03701fe0334155f1eb5d03ae86

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix CG snapshot deletion

This adds a function missing on the driver that was making impossible
to delete a consistency group snapshot.

Change-Id: I4d6a4f5cf4f4f0f751e1378d3747d2aacc050d24
Closes-bug: #1788418
Closes-bug: #1777862
(cherry picked from commit 8d9090700e89f8885739b0885500d845efb976a6)
(cherry picked from commit fb69816509c86736a8cf8e1c9602873f3a787ed3)
(cherry picked from commit e201d5fcb51fa4fa5292768ad31fcd952a7979e2)

commit_message:
Allow setting network info from ironic

Allow setting of network properties based on ironic node attributes when
using ironic inventory.

Change-Id: I5f99a7dc5d2d7796c108ab195cf31479a90cbdd5

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I055d12d183795b491f74a5cd89070d9089b8d529
Story: #2004073
Task: #27446

commit_message:
Define qos-rules-alias extension

This patch adds qos-rules-alias extension to enable users to perform
GET, PUT and DELETE operations on QoS rules as though they are first
level resources. In other words, the user doesn't have to specify the
QoS policy ID

Change-Id: I5366dfee9b760ff5c884981582cdd17245b4d16f
Partial-Bug: #1777627

commit_message:
Add some more docs for upgrade checkers

This adds a few more things to the upgrade checks
reference docs after getting questions about it
during the Stein release goal implementation from
other project teams:

1. Notes the high level set of steps for upgrading
   nova in grenade and where nova-status fits into
   that sequence.

2. Links to the oslo.upgradecheck library which
   didn't exist when the original document was
   written.

3. Adds a FAQs section with Q&A for several things
   that have come up during the Stein release goal.

Change-Id: I990e5dbe563fa342f7481c3720445b924447ad54
Story: 2003657

commit_message:
DNM: test tempest-full-oslo-master

Do not merge.

This change simply tests the new tempest-full-oslo-master job.

It will be abandoned later...

To save resources, it has removed all other check jobs.

Change-Id: Ieb5137c1aaa0234145418573b39ccad6dc642e9e

commit_message:
api-ref: remove created_at from response example of list-transfer

created_at is only present in "List volume transfers and details", 
and not in "List volume transfers for a project".
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html#list-volume-transfers-for-a-project
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html#list-volume-transfers-and-details

So created_at should be removed from the response example of
"List volume transfers for a project".

Change-Id: I52a81454a995920c1ba5534fea3d50f6c9986881

commit_message:
api-ref: qos and extra_spec are optional in types view

As Felipe commented in I7ef9b3ea989d65dbd6dfa291ab4752664ed5f935,
extra_specs and qos_specs_id are only populated following policy
authorization: https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/e1d8ec8b26bff6bc56d68f31e2f76f27038c8b9e/cinder/api/v2/views/types.py#L31
So this is to make them optional.

Change-Id: I6f5103b7333b80b9651c279053dbdecd4574c18b

commit_message:
api-ref: Add response fields and response example for volume manage

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html#manage-an-existing-volume
Response fields and response example are missing in the
"Manage an existing volume" api ref, this is to add them.

Change-Id: If624b672d1723a7226741da85802de87979f6c12

[{'created': '2018-09-14 21:17:20.000000000', 'message': 'Skip test for testr hook being installed when testr is not available

pbr only depends on testrepository in the test requirements, so
packaging efforts can decide to skip the dependency if they want to.
As stestr is going to replace testrepository going forward, it makes
sense to make dependencies to testrepository optional.

Skip the test that requires testrepository in that scenario.

Change-Id: I28c30411a5a6fdb071ebcc35e65ce1f4f1242498
'}]
commit_message:
Skip test for testr hook being installed when testr is not available

pbr only depends on testrepository in the test requirements, so
packaging efforts can decide to skip the dependency if they want to.
As stestr is going to replace testrepository going forward, it makes
sense to make dependencies to testrepository optional.

Skip the test that requires testrepository in that scenario.

Change-Id: I28c30411a5a6fdb071ebcc35e65ce1f4f1242498

subject: tox: Suppress output
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-04 10:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-04 10:32:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@mtreinish Hopefully you have some idea why the '--suppress-output' flag is necessary here but not e.g. nova"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-10-04 13:30:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So the reason --suppress-output might be needed here instead of in nova is because the tests here output to stdout as common course, while in nova they do not, and in most other test suites they do not (from a quick glance at the last patch merged it's probably because of subprocess commands, which is something the stestr tests do too). By default stestr will print all the stdout attachments it encounters for a test because something being written to stdout is likely a bug during a test run. It's most often likely a missed print() for debugging or another mistake that wasn't intentional. So instead of hiding it by default and only printing it on failure it prints that attachment by default. The --suppress-output flag is there because this assumption isn't always true, basically for this kind of use case where the tests print a ton to stdout even on a successful run."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-04 15:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-04 15:37:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

 > nova is because the tests here output to stdout as common course,
 > while in nova they do not, and in most other test suites they do
 > not (from a quick glance at the last patch merged it's probably
 > because of subprocess commands, which is something the stestr tests
 > do too). By default stestr will print all the stdout attachments it
 > encounters for a test because something being written to stdout is
 > likely a bug during a test run. It's most often likely a missed
 > print() for debugging or another mistake that wasn't intentional.
 > So instead of hiding it by default and only printing it on failure
 > it prints that attachment by default. The --suppress-output flag is
 > there because this assumption isn't always true, basically for this
 > kind of use case where the tests print a ton to stdout even on a
 > successful run.

Ah good point. If that's the case, it seems this is the correct approach to take. Thanks for the quick follow-up!"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-06 18:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-15 15:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2018-10-04 10:21:52.000000000', 'message': "tox: Suppress output

Since the switch to stestr in commit 2222dbb47, the tests have taken to
spewing a load of noise. This seems to be because we dropped the
configuration for OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE and OS_STDERR_CAPTURE, which was
previously configured in '.testr.conf'. This is fixed. However, it seems
it's also necessary to explicitly pass the '--suppress-output' option to
'stestr' to properly silence things. I'm not sure why this is necessary
and no other project seems to require it, but it does do what I think.

As an aside, finding out what caused this output was easier said than
done. I tried stestr, testr and fixtures, before finally finding it in
subunit.

Change-Id: I1678bcd26b41fdf09f98c36fc095d6d4c1826deb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-10-04 15:36:54.000000000', 'message': "tox: Suppress output

Since the switch to stestr in commit 2222dbb47, the tests have taken to
spewing a load of noise. This seems to be because we dropped the

previously configured in '.testr.conf'. This is fixed. However, it seems
it's also necessary to explicitly pass the '--suppress-attachments'
option to 'stestr' to properly silence things. This seems to be
necessary because many pbr commands output to stdout by default, while
other projects (nova, etc.) use 'logging'. Use of this option requires
stestr 2.1.0 [1] so we bump the lower-constraint.

As an aside, finding out what caused this output was easier said than
done. I tried stestr, testr and fixtures, before finally finding it in
subunit.

[1] https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/commit/1316ebd7

Change-Id: I1678bcd26b41fdf09f98c36fc095d6d4c1826deb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Suppress output

Since the switch to stestr in commit 2222dbb47, the tests have taken to
spewing a load of noise. This seems to be because we dropped the
configuration for OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE and OS_STDERR_CAPTURE, which was
previously configured in '.testr.conf'. This is fixed. However, it seems
it's also necessary to explicitly pass the '--suppress-attachments'
option to 'stestr' to properly silence things. This seems to be
necessary because many pbr commands output to stdout by default, while
other projects (nova, etc.) use 'logging'. Use of this option requires
stestr 2.1.0 [1] so we bump the lower-constraint.

As an aside, finding out what caused this output was easier said than
done. I tried stestr, testr and fixtures, before finally finding it in
subunit.

[1] https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/commit/1316ebd7

Change-Id: I1678bcd26b41fdf09f98c36fc095d6d4c1826deb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-10 14:50:03.000000000', 'message': 'Nagios: Update image with Elasticsearch plugin headers

This updates the Nagios image to include an update to the
Elasticsearch plugin that adds the appropriate headers to the
request sent to Elasticsearch. As Elasticsearch >=6.0 no longer
tries to determine the request data type, we need to explicitly
tell Elasticsearch the request body is JSON. Since we use
Elasticsearch 5.6.4 as default, this change will make the
deprecation warnings for the 6.0 breaking change go away.

Change-Id: I0dbd8859ca8d0bd0893832b4edd92742e575598b

commit_message:
Nagios: Update image with Elasticsearch plugin headers

This updates the Nagios image to include an update to the
Elasticsearch plugin that adds the appropriate headers to the
request sent to Elasticsearch. As Elasticsearch >=6.0 no longer
tries to determine the request data type, we need to explicitly
tell Elasticsearch the request body is JSON. Since we use
Elasticsearch 5.6.4 as default, this change will make the
deprecation warnings for the 6.0 breaking change go away.

Change-Id: I0dbd8859ca8d0bd0893832b4edd92742e575598b

commit_message:
py3: Don't purge python-six on upgrades

python-six is also used by crmsh in HA deployment so don't purge it
on OpenStack upgrade or we lose the ability to manage the corosync/
pacemaker cluster.

Change-Id: I67791cf6ef64aa461b9957c1d253d5aa7703f19e

commit_message:
Add microversion 2.67 to rest api version history

Add microversion 2.67 to REST API Version History, it is used as an
index by novaclient's release note, and rename the "test_block_device"
test case
"test_from_api_invalid_oneof_image_id_or_destination_local_mapping" to
"test_from_api_invalid_image_to_destination_local_mapping", mentioned by
melwitt.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606398/

Part of blueprint boot-instance-specific-storage-backend

Change-Id: Ic6d562947f445c6f6cabd69484bc85b7aea88e48

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 13:25:47.000000000', 'message': 'Change way how second NIC in guest OS is configured

In case of RHEL based operating system used in guest vm in
test_network_v6 module, there is need to prepare

    /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-%(nic)s

file with "IPV6INIT=yes" to enable IPv6 on it.
Otherwise IPv6 will not be configured on this NIC when:

    ip link set up dev %(nic)s

will be executed and tests with dualnet=False will fail.
This isn't necessary on systems like Ubuntu or Cirros.

Change-Id: I397b1c3584a045f9ca4f47b4e691385628d35efa
Closes-Bug: #1795891
'}, {'created': '2018-10-05 08:28:14.000000000', 'message': 'Change way how second NIC in guest OS is configured

In case of RHEL based operating system used in guest vm in
test_network_v6 module, there is need to prepare

    /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-%(nic)s

file with "IPV6INIT=yes" to enable IPv6 on it.
Otherwise IPv6 will not be configured on this NIC when:

    ip link set up dev %(nic)s

will be executed and tests with dualnet=False will fail.
This isn't necessary on systems like Ubuntu or Cirros.

Change-Id: I397b1c3584a045f9ca4f47b4e691385628d35efa
Closes-Bug: #1795891
'}, {'created': '2018-10-05 15:00:00.000000000', 'message': 'Change way how second NIC in guest OS is configured

In case of systems where NetworkManager is available, like RHEL
second NIC will be configured with nmcli tool instead of
using iproute tools will still use network manager and connection
on such device will still be logically disconnected after:

    ip link set up dev %(nic)s

Because of that IPv6 is not properly configured on such interface
in case of DHCP v6 tests with dualnet=True.
Using network manager if "nmcli" is available fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I397b1c3584a045f9ca4f47b4e691385628d35efa
Closes-Bug: #1795891

    ip link set up dev %(nic)s

will be executed and tests with dualnet=False will fail.
This isn't necessary on systems like Ubuntu or Cirros.

Change-Id: I397b1c3584a045f9ca4f47b4e691385628d35efa
Closes-Bug: #1795891
'}]
commit_message:
Change way how second NIC in guest OS is configured

In case of RHEL based operating system used in guest vm in
test_network_v6 module, there is need to prepare

    /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-%(nic)s

file with "IPV6INIT=yes" to enable IPv6 on it.
Otherwise IPv6 will not be configured on this NIC when:

    ip link set up dev %(nic)s

will be executed and tests with dualnet=False will fail.
This isn't necessary on systems like Ubuntu or Cirros.

Change-Id: I397b1c3584a045f9ca4f47b4e691385628d35efa
Closes-Bug: #1795891

commit_message:
Un-deprecate the nova-consoleauth service

The nova-consoleauth service was erroneously deprecated in Rocky even
though it is still required by nova-api. Console token auths are being
stored in both nova-consoleauth _and_ the database in Rocky.

This is a partial revert to remove "deprecation" language from the
following commits:

  * c53c9ea759462c0294775562b81df7cba9fa2027
  * f0d2925bc71d0649f75fd3d281742f2e56e7e3b6
  * 8bb8045b590fc562a2a5221119f100c8695835f5
  * 969239029d4a13956747e6e0b850d6c6ab4035f0

Closes-Bug: #1793255

Change-Id: Ie6542c1b1b681c5fce6b24c3e09b8fe18b8c3a8c

commit_message:
Revert "Deprecate the nova-consoleauth service"

This reverts commit e91dad3ee93b1c0c4201e1e679a8c5b333879b5f.

The release notes said it was okay not to run the nova-consoleauth
service in Rocky, but that's not true because the Rocky code is storing
new console authorization tokens in both the database backend and the
existing nova-consoleauth backend. The use of nova-consoleauth will be
discontinued in Stein (for non-cells v1). We can't remove
nova-consoleauth until we remove cells v1.

Partial-Bug: #1788470

 Conflicts:
    api-guide/source/general_info.rst
    releasenotes/notes/deprecate-nova-consoleauth-ed6ccbc324a0fb10.yaml

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are due to the fact that the nova-ec2
service no longer exists in the api-guide and the release note had
been modified in 4f01f4ff88de571218a36ba7c4e998296a7b52a4 after being
added in e91dad3ee93b1c0c4201e1e679a8c5b333879b5f.

Change-Id: Ic7a89aa23a2ea247792186bad32d0d37c17de6af

commit_message:
Use nova-consoleauth only if workaround enabled

In Rocky, we deprecated the nova-consoleauth service but there were
unconditional calls to nova-consoleauth in the compute/api, which
made it impossible to avoid running the nova-consoleauth service.

This adds conditional checks to call nova-consoleauth only if the
[workarounds]enable_consoleauth configuration option is True. The
option defaults to False because the default console token auth TTL
is 10 minutes and only operators who have configured much longer TTL
or otherwise wish to avoid resetting all consoles at upgrade time
need to use the option.

This also updates the /os-console-auth-tokens/{console_token} API to
use nova-consoleauth only if the [workarounds] option is enabled. This
had to be done in the same change because the conditional checks in
the compute/api code caused the /os-console-auth-tokens API functional
tests to fail to find token authorizations in nova-consoleauth.

Closes-Bug: #1788470
Closes-Bug: #1795982

Change-Id: Iff6020f1a10afc476864f979faf251ef5a1a6184

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:48:16.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Idbae9cd525a0a40f5f04164c301fcec1151d5434
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Idbae9cd525a0a40f5f04164c301fcec1151d5434
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I2129ff5454ad7e2f94736ea750ca3f2d6d78e1ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 16:39:02.000000000', 'message': 'Allow terminating a lease in ERROR state

Adds a valid state transition from ERROR => TERMINATING, which should
allow an existing lease in the ERROR state to at least attempt to clean
itself up upon lease end. If this state transition is not allowed,
leases in the ERROR state effectively will not be cleaned up and their
reservations stick around - they will never release them.

Change-Id: I1fbd922d921b7a643379c93ca6b2ebb4edde9c7a
Closes-Bug: 1793560
'}, {'created': '2018-10-01 15:54:28.000000000', 'message': 'Allow terminating a lease in ERROR state

This patch adds a valid state transition from ERROR to TERMINATING,
which should allow a lease in the ERROR state to at least attempt to
clean itself up upon lease end. If this state transition is not allowed,
leases in the ERROR state effectively will not be cleaned up and their
hosts will stay in the corresponding aggregate instead of being returned
to the freepool.

This is compounded by the fact that leases can easily go into ERROR
state because of bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/blazar/+bug/1786031.

Change-Id: I1fbd922d921b7a643379c93ca6b2ebb4edde9c7a
Closes-Bug: 1793560
'}, {'created': '2018-10-09 12:22:41.000000000', 'message': 'Allow terminating a lease in ERROR state

which should allow a lease in the ERROR state to at least attempt to
clean itself up upon lease end. If this state transition is not allowed,

hosts will stay in the corresponding aggregate instead of being returned
to the freepool.

This is compounded by the fact that leases can easily go into ERROR
state because of bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/blazar/+bug/1786031.

Change-Id: I1fbd922d921b7a643379c93ca6b2ebb4edde9c7a
Closes-Bug: #1793560
'}, {'created': '2018-10-15 14:08:33.000000000', 'message': 'Allow terminating a lease in ERROR state

This patch adds a valid state transition from ERROR to TERMINATING,
which should allow a lease in the ERROR state to at least attempt to
clean itself up upon lease end. If this state transition is not allowed,

This is compounded by the fact that leases can easily go into ERROR

Change-Id: I1fbd922d921b7a643379c93ca6b2ebb4edde9c7a
Closes-Bug: #1793560
'}]
commit_message:
Allow terminating a lease in ERROR state

This patch adds a valid state transition from ERROR to TERMINATING,
which should allow a lease in the ERROR state to at least attempt to
clean itself up upon lease end. If this state transition is not allowed,
leases in the ERROR state effectively will not be cleaned up and their
hosts will stay in the corresponding aggregate instead of being returned
to the freepool.

This is compounded by the fact that leases can easily go into ERROR
state because of bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/blazar/+bug/1786031.

Change-Id: I1fbd922d921b7a643379c93ca6b2ebb4edde9c7a
Closes-Bug: #1793560

subject: Add header 'accept: application/json' for requests
messages:
[{'account_id': 18205, 'date': '2018-03-25 18:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18205, 'date': '2018-03-26 06:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-10-15 17:10:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This does not seem complete in case of SLO, where several places rely on the response containing JSON (and at other times, it must be plain). I can see this helping DLO.

The approach in the place where the fix is seems agreeable to me. It is better to override headers than screw with the common environ.

Finally, this needs a test where client supplies a different Accept header when downloading. Possibly a functional test, although I'd prefer a unit. Remember that to be useful, the new test must fail on the old code."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-25 18:20:12.000000000', 'message': "DLO expects json response

The client should set header 'Accept: application/json'
in case if it expects json, not plain text.

Change-Id: Ie72df8be3b042c32a8bc441ab7a4a43fe7641ee1
Closes-Bug: 1758710
"}, {'created': '2018-03-26 06:27:32.000000000', 'message': "Add header 'accept: application/json' for requests

The client should set header 'Accept: application/json'
in case if it expects json.

Change-Id: Ie72df8be3b042c32a8bc441ab7a4a43fe7641ee1
Closes-Bug: 1758710
"}]
commit_message:
Add header 'accept: application/json' for requests

The client should set header 'Accept: application/json'
in case if it expects json.

Change-Id: Ie72df8be3b042c32a8bc441ab7a4a43fe7641ee1
Closes-Bug: 1758710

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:49:31.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I14aef3de2d663ef36930285401a52f06eb30488d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-01 21:40:58.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I14aef3de2d663ef36930285401a52f06eb30488d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I14aef3de2d663ef36930285401a52f06eb30488d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version
on Xenial, now that we have Bionic Beaver nodes
that support python3.7, lets switch to testing
with python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in
Stein and beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: Ia9868f39ff788e02850fae756820f7c1388bde0a
Depends-On: I4b2149cf7033f16a37cd185e5f19ab2e7e837cdf
Story: #2004073
Task: #27427

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I86165fd2347393e9567217b70937ecc6c70a2754
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I322b41af61ddf4d00f70707349e0e6753a18c418
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update lib-forward-testing

The tempest-full job can replace the legacy job
legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src since tempest installs the checked out
libraries, including the library under test. We have already converted
the py3 variant, and can convert the py2 the same way.

The Zuul v3 native tempest-full job is not available on stable/ocata, so
use the legacy job on ocata and older.

Move the template to project-templates file and add description.

Change-Id: Iac9162c1321f7f825684e1c20cc13ff5821d37d3

subject: iscsi: workaround to let podman read /dev/null
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-09-06 20:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-09-06 20:03:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-06 20:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2\n\nwho needs /dev/null anyway'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-09-07 02:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-15 16:05:27.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I0cc0a867764b331abf270f9670b28d3d97ca372e'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 20:01:32.000000000', 'message': "iscsi: workaround to let podman read /dev/null

We currently hit this bug: https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1412
In order to move forward, let's bind-mount /dev/null into the container
until the bug is fixed. Note, it doesn't hurt docker deployment as we
already mounted /dev.

Change-Id: I0e885c248bb08c04fb9b7efa9e075e692879b450
"}, {'created': '2018-09-06 20:03:31.000000000', 'message': "iscsi: workaround to let podman read /dev/null

We currently hit this bug: https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1412
In order to move forward, let's bind-mount /dev/null into the container
until the bug is fixed. Note, it doesn't hurt docker deployment as we
already mounted /dev.

commit_message:
iscsi: workaround to let podman read /dev/null

We currently hit this bug: https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1412
In order to move forward, let's bind-mount /dev/null into the container
until the bug is fixed. Note, it doesn't hurt docker deployment as we
already mounted /dev.

Related-Bug: #1791167
Change-Id: I0e885c248bb08c04fb9b7efa9e075e692879b450

commit_message:
Add voting and gating test with Keystone enabled

Without this test, the Ironic services might end up
misconfigured and machines can not be provisioned
properly. The Ironic configuration templates
that Bifrost uses should be validated for both
Keystone enabled and disabled.

Change-Id: Iab4457a6dcea232b5c19e681dc87b08570c2a120
Depends-On: I4c733dba8e65fe624c9de5b9c5722cef2df59109

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: Add support for excluded_domain_ips

The Dell EMC SC configuration option excluded_domain_ip has been
deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Deployments
should now migrate to the option excluded_domain_ips for
equivalent functionality.

Change-Id: If517d1260b690c32eba6f7b6dab55c9dced78de7

Without this patch, there is a dependency between the two
repositories OSH and OSH-infra, which will cause a circular
dependency problem when trying to remove the duplicated jobs
that will appear in OSH.

Change-Id: Ibeee0a853d0c1358519b0391c879137d8a214be2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency to OSH repository for test jobs

Without this patch, there is a dependency between the two
repositories OSH and OSH-infra, which will cause a circular
dependency problem when trying to remove the duplicated jobs
that will appear in OSH.

Change-Id: Ibeee0a853d0c1358519b0391c879137d8a214be2

subject: Add ERL args parameter for rabbit and set the busy wait threshold to none
messages:
[{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-09-27 08:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-09-28 06:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-03 19:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2018-10-15 15:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 5018fa8215a2b1ddb709c6f8e8f7119d295f7652'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-27 08:54:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add ERL args parameter for rabbit and set the busy wait threshold to none

Additional argument to be able to customize the ERL command line
arguments. This allows the operator to specify some arguments to the
Erlang VM. By default we are now passing '+sbwt none' to set the
the erlang scheduler busy wait threshold. This threshold determines how
long schedulers are to busy wait when running out of work before going
to sleep. On most of our deployments where rabbitmq shares a node with
a lot of other services it makes little sense to busy wait when out of
work in order to improve latency as other processes are more likely to
fail to do work due to CPUs being overused by rabbit,

We have measured a three-fold reduction of CPU usage with this option
with no other observable impact.

We can observe the change in the beam.smp params:
root         346  0.0  0.0  11680  1468 ?        S    18:29   0:00  \_ /bin/sh /usr/sbin/rabbitmq-server
root         367  0.0  0.0  81940  2060 ?        S    18:29   0:00      \_ su rabbitmq -s /bin/sh -c /usr/lib/rabbitmq/bin/rabbitmq-server
rabbitmq     372  0.0  0.0   9672  1520 ?        Ss   18:29   0:00          \_ /bin/sh /usr/lib/rabbitmq/bin/rabbitmq-server
rabbitmq     561  2.6  0.5 2365936 122036 ?      Sl   18:29   1:04              \_ /usr/lib64/erlang/erts-7.3.1.4/bin/beam.smp -W w -A 64 -K true -P 1048576 -K true -sbwt none -B i -- -root /usr/lib64/erlang -progname erl -- -home /var/lib/rabbitmq -- -pa /usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.6.15/ebin -noshell -noinput -s rabbit boot -sname rabbit@controller-0 -boot start_sasl -config /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq -kernel inet_default_connect_options [{nodelay,true}] -kernel inet_default_connect_options [{nodelay,true}] -sasl errlog_type error -sasl sasl_error_logger false -rabbit error_logger {file,"/var/log/rabbitmq/rabbit@controller-0.log"} -rabbit sasl_error_logger {file,"/var/log/rabbitmq/rabbit@controller-0-sasl.log"} -rabbit enabled_plugins_file "/etc/rabbitmq/enabled_plugins" -rabbit plugins_dir "/usr/lib/rabbitmq/plugins:/usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.6.15/plugins" -rabbit plugins_expand_dir "/var/lib/rabbitmq/mnesia/rabbit@controller-0-plugins-expand" -os_mon start_cpu_sup false -os_mon start_disksup false -os_mon start_memsup false -mnesia dir "/var/lib/rabbitmq/mnesia/rabbit@controller-0"
rabbitmq     703  0.0  0.0  11588   448 ?        Ss   18:29   0:00                  \_ inet_gethost 4
rabbitmq     704  0.0  0.0  13712   708 ?        S    18:29   0:00                      \_ inet_gethost 4

Change-Id: I0ce91ed9132afe305c60036837c702c2611fa7c2
(cherry picked from commit 06b66a8094b2ab0be844d4bd1996d760a27e0b2b)
'}]
commit_message:
Add ERL args parameter for rabbit and set the busy wait threshold to none

Additional argument to be able to customize the ERL command line
arguments. This allows the operator to specify some arguments to the
Erlang VM. By default we are now passing '+sbwt none' to set the
the erlang scheduler busy wait threshold. This threshold determines how
long schedulers are to busy wait when running out of work before going
to sleep. On most of our deployments where rabbitmq shares a node with
a lot of other services it makes little sense to busy wait when out of
work in order to improve latency as other processes are more likely to
fail to do work due to CPUs being overused by rabbit,

We have measured a three-fold reduction of CPU usage with this option
with no other observable impact.

We can observe the change in the beam.smp params:
root         346  0.0  0.0  11680  1468 ?        S    18:29   0:00  \_ /bin/sh /usr/sbin/rabbitmq-server
root         367  0.0  0.0  81940  2060 ?        S    18:29   0:00      \_ su rabbitmq -s /bin/sh -c /usr/lib/rabbitmq/bin/rabbitmq-server

commit_message:
/tmp with noexec fix

Adds option to specify tmp folder prefix and also defines a
default tmp folder outside of /tmp.

There's also a new validation that makes sure that scripts
are executable.

Change-Id: If8b0bef0e6afdf2a72a4043e1295d953db8b8190
Closes-Bug: #1796220

commit_message:
/tmp with noexec fix

Adds option to specify tmp folder prefix and also defines a
default tmp folder outside of /tmp.

There's also a new validation that makes sure that scripts
are executable.

Change-Id: Icc568d0750826b2da24e7fa3bfa6def0fb151209
Closes-Bug: #1796220

subject: releasenotes: oslo-messaging-separate-backends add project name
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 14:01:43.000000000', 'message': '    releasenotes: oslo-messaging-separate-backends add project name

    Without this patch, the release notes published at
    https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/openstack-ansible/rocky.html contains
    the same line multiple times which is not very clear.

    [...]
        Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notifications
        to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.

        Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notifications
        to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.
    [...]

    Change-Id: I0ed1a43670d97f2e2215d04c641f7bd4cfbe4f44

Change-Id: I63ca06ac4f05a9ae1a6ca148d16fccdb74fbb376
'}]
commit_message:
releasenotes: oslo-messaging-separate-backends add project name

    Without this patch, the release notes published at
    https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/openstack-ansible/rocky.html contains
    the same line multiple times which is not very clear.

    [...]
        Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notifications
        to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.

        Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notifications
        to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.
    [...]

    Change-Id: I0ed1a43670d97f2e2215d04c641f7bd4cfbe4f44

Change-Id: I63ca06ac4f05a9ae1a6ca148d16fccdb74fbb376

subject: Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+
messages: [{'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:39:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:46:00.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nThere's already a review at: https://review.openstack.org/610077"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 14:39:54.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ibd7f7f51ccec4b333a25acafa38798d37fbd7071
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440
"}]
commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ibd7f7f51ccec4b333a25acafa38798d37fbd7071
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440

[{'created': '2017-12-15 19:32:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add configuration option to manage swift polling interval

By default Ceilometer will poll Swift every 10 minutes, with this patch
users can tweak the interval to their need.

The configuration file /etc/ceilometer/pipeline.yaml will be managed by
juju, currently it is not. On every change of this file
ceilometer-collector daemon is restart.

Change-Id: Ie18a5284812f4f698b929b9e17b34289e7732bf7

commit_message:
Add config to manipulate the pipeline.yaml

The configuration file /etc/ceilometer/pipeline.yaml will be managed by
juju, currently it is not. On every change of this file
ceilometer-collector daemon is restarted.

Change-Id: Ie18a5284812f4f698b929b9e17b34289e7732bf7
Closes-Bug: 1715672

commit_message:
Add diagram to major upgrade developer docs

This uses the plantuml tool which should be the easiest option for us
to edit diagrams collaboratively, as all you need to make edits is any
text editor and the plantuml image generator, which is quite easily
available (e.g. packaged in Fedora).

Change-Id: I6cd7459fdf1e14825940f245fd539fa1a72b1067

commit_message:
switch documentation job to new PTI

This is a mechanically generated patch to switch the documentation
jobs to use the new PTI versions of the jobs as part of the
python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I2dad881a79661aaa0bde50f805db9a3687d1a83e
Story: #2002586
Task: #24758

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 10:46:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix reconnect_interval parameter

There is a typo in the logic around reconnect_intervl
which makes it skip setting the interval.

Let's fix that by making the code more explicit.
Tested with a custom reconnect interval set via:
ExtraConfig:
  pacemaker_remote_reconnect_interval: 120

And obtained the correct state of the remote resource:
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs resource show compute-0 |grep reconnect
  Attributes: reconnect_interval=120 server=172.17.1.14

Before the fix there would be no reconnect_interval
attribute.

Change-Id: I5af578b5b838deec7beb2d5a9bb83fa6bb6293b7
Related-Bug: #1797041
"}]
commit_message:
Fix reconnect_interval parameter

There is a typo in the logic around reconnect_intervl
which makes it skip setting the interval.

Let's fix that by making the code more explicit.
Tested with a custom reconnect interval set via:
ExtraConfig:
  pacemaker_remote_reconnect_interval: 120

And obtained the correct state of the remote resource:
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs resource show compute-0 |grep reconnect
  Attributes: reconnect_interval=120 server=172.17.1.14

Before the fix there would be no reconnect_interval
attribute.

Change-Id: I5af578b5b838deec7beb2d5a9bb83fa6bb6293b7
Related-Bug: #1797041

subject: Increment versioning with pbr instruction
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:47:32.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I6e61c2862563f08a7f6f18050301ef77bd10de25
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I6e61c2862563f08a7f6f18050301ef77bd10de25
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

    to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.

    to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.
[...]

(3 comments)

One microversion is enough, IMO.

Also, we need to be able to stop supporting an API that is a terrible idea. We spend ENTIRELY too much time trying to support buggy, unsafe behaviour in the API because someone might be relying on that buggy unsafe behaviour in some client version somewhere. We have already spent too much time, IMO, debating what should be a fairly simple thing: add a new microversion to signal to users when nova stops being silly and unsafe w.r.t. live migration resource accounting and let's move on.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-10 13:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Remove force flag from live-migrate and evacuate

Force live-migrate and evacuate operations cannot be meaningfully supported
for servers having complex resource allocations. So this spec proposes to
remove the ``force`` flag from these operations in a new REST API
microversion.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I1fad03e7fca734bec9a045df0d3d72d9012f6159
Blueprint: remove-force-flag-from-live-migrate-and-evacuate
